First off, there is a two hour time limit. Sounds limited, especially since you're doing the cooking, but you'll be stuffed within the first hour. Everything was superb, can you believe this is an AYCE Wagyu restaurant! They also have many prepared dishes. The service was impeccable, the food was top notch and the ambience was a very upscale date night vibe. There is reasonable valet parking with validation. Had an incredible time at Niku X! The food and atmosphere were amazing, but what really made the experience special were Darren and Byron. They were so friendly, attentive, and genuinely went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Their service made the whole night unforgettable ‚Äî thank you both! Highly recommend NikuX, especially if you‚Äôre lucky enough to have Darren and Byron taking care of you!

This is good for a one time thing. I paid after tips and two drinks $410 for booth seating. I picked 2 $149 options, I couldn‚Äôt justify it if it wasn‚Äôt my birthday haha, the food was very good. The service was great, the portions per serving were a little small but reasonable for unlimited style. You‚Äôre able to pick two cuts of meat at a time and as many sides as you want, I filled my table to the brim with food to make my moneys worth. But I still feel like I only got 80% of my value back, they did not slow me down but the cut off time did catch up to me.

They have a cut off for cooked dishes from the kitchen 1 and a half hours into your 2 hour time. It‚Äôs odd but not unreasonable, I was given a a drink for free which was nice. I can say I would go again but I would choose the $109 buffet seating rather than the steak house seating. Hubster and I visited for our 27th wedding anniversary and we were BLOWN AWAY!  Perfect service (they actually carried in a bench seat for us because the chairs were too narrow) all the food was amazing! But I highly suggest the Chilean Sea Bass wraps! Life changing!!! The sashimi was THE best I've had in SoCal.  We loved that they had warm butter on tap (I would have preferred it to not be garlic butter) The steaks absolutely ruined me for all future steaks! Melt in your mouth doesn't do it justice.  I expected to focus on the lobster tail but to be honest, I was a little disappointed in them. I tried 3 different tails and none of them were easy to remove from the shell even though they were all cut down the back. The flavor was good however and they were nice sized. The star of the night was by far the Chilean Sea Bass!!! Do not skip it! We paid $119 each plus $16 for valet parking (loved that option) and we considered it completely worth every penny. Even if its only a once in a lifetime visit, you should definitely go! The restaurant is located inside the Intercontinental Hotel on the 2nd floor. You can park in the garage or valet and they will validate 2.5 hours. We got seated right away with reservations for a friend's birthday and service was extraordinary.There's two weekend dinner options: regular $119/$109 for Chubby plus members)or $159/$149(members).

Buffet: fruits, seaweed and octopus salad, ceviche, raw veggies to grill, regular salad and sauces.
Sushi: crudo of tuna, salmon, yellowtail, tartare and unagi don.
Meat display: brisket and chef's choice.

Hot Seafood: King crab and snow crab served hot not cold like other buffets.  They used to have lobster tails accessible, but you now order with your server and it came out hot, precut for easy peeling, and so plump, juicy, and sweet! Also, even though our reservation was at 5:30PM,  they had ran out of hot seafood at 5:45PM. Instead of refilling it, they said they will refill it at 6PM. So expect to come back.  They refilled it around 6PM and everything was cooked perfectly;  not overcooked or dry. Both types of crab legs were sweet, juicy, and slightly salty. Perhaps because it is not the season, the King crab legs were sadly skinny.
Raw Bar: scallops, shrimp, prawns and mussels with their respective sauces and sushi rolls.

Order with Server:
Appetizers: potato tarrine: flaky layers of deep fried potato.
Oxtail potsticker: juicy and flavorful.
Miso Chilean seabass on a lettuce cup: our favorite but the miso glaze was a bit too sweet for us.
Wagyu curry: texture of slightly crunchy carrots, tender wagyu beef over rice is just so comforting and hearty.
The men really loved shitshito peppers
Other apps: deep fried broccoli, miso corn, wagyu pepper beef, chicken wings, waffle fries which is basic.

Soups: tom yum is good for those who like the kick of spice and hint of coconut.
Miso soup: Ironically, it didn't taste like miso soup, it was more like light dashi soup with mushrooms, tofu and seaweed.
Desserts: egg tarts are a must if you want crispy, flakey, and crunchy layers of crust with just enough egg custard.
Another favorite was the mille crepe with chocolate cream, but was informed tonight, it is not offered anymore.
Hazelnut cake: not too sweet and soft.
Other desserts: earl Grey and vanilla cake roll was okay. They don't make some of the desserts and instead choose to serve those packaged cakes you get from the Asian grocery store. The dessert option doesn‚Äôt align with the premium exclusive experience they're aiming for.

Meats: sticking to the basic menu is just as satisfying especially if you enjoy the thinner slices of brisket and beef tongue. If you really want to try the thicker cuts of premium meats, then choose the premium menu. Sadly, our favorite, the aged tomahawk which has to be reserved 24 hours in advance was removed from their menu so it is no longer an option.
Drinks: yuzu sparkler and peach slush.
Refreshing and so good after a salty and fatty meal. No comment, I can probably down a gallon of it.

And lastly, Joe ,our server, was so friendly and fun. He made wonderful recommendations and was responsive to all of our requests. He made everything so fast and easy by having the bill and parking validation ready before we even had to ask about it. He even threw in special little touches like a grilled lobster tail option that is not on the menu, and made everyone have an amazing dinner experience. Do note, the grilled lobster tail was very salty, so you can ask them to be a little less heavy handed in the seasoning if possible.

Overall, this is a great place to celebrate a special occasion like birthdays or anniversaries for unlimited seafood and specialty meats like A5 wagyu.  They do stritctly enforce the 90 min so I would avoid bringing babies or young children, those who don't eat and or picky eaters if possible as you may spend most of your time catering to them. If you can't, you have to be really strategic to maximize your time and pocket. Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Reservation Reservations recommended Noise level Moderate noise Special events No special event Wait time No wait Parking space Plenty of parking Parking options Valet, Paid parking garage Parking The restaurant is located inside the Intercontinental Hotel. You will take the escalator to the 2nd floor.  Also if you valet your car, they will validate 2.5 hours. Kid-friendliness I wouldn't take young kids here as they really enforce a 90 min time limit.

Our birthday celebration at Niku X was excellent.

Darren was so attentive, helpful, and friendly. We didn't have to look around for him to place our orders or ask questions. I loved his friendly and approachable smile. In addition to Darren, there was one other gentleman that helped us a lot, I neglected to obtain his name. Our water glass and drinks were never empty, table was never overcrowded with plates, and our grill was changed multiple times just in time.

The food was excellent. The seafood, sushi, meats, special dishes, and dessert were so fresh. The portion were also the perfect sizes. It was our sons first time. They loved it and we plan to go back for another birthday celebration. Can't even rank the food, since they were all so good!

So glad we saved dessert for last. The egg tarts were amazing. I want more!

We left very satisfied. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Reservation Reservation required Noise level Quiet, easy to talk Group size Suitable for all group sizes Wait time No wait

Our water glass and drinks were never empty, table was never overcrowded with plates, and our grill was changed multiple times just in time.

The food was excellent. The seafood, sushi, meats, special dishes, and dessert were so fresh. The portion were also the perfect sizes. It was our sons first time. They loved it and we plan to go back for another birthday celebration. Can't even rank the food, since they were all so good!

So glad we saved dessert for last. The egg tarts were amazing. I want more!

A5 Wagyu Heaven ‚Äî Worth Every Penny

The $149 all-you-can-eat A5 Wagyu beef experience at Niku is absolutely worth it. This isn‚Äôt just dinner‚Äîit‚Äôs a culinary event. The cheaper tier lets you cook the meat yourself, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend that‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre like me and don‚Äôt even enjoy cooking at home. Ruining such delicate, premium beef would feel like a crime.

There‚Äôs a wide range of offerings beyond beef‚Äîseafood, sushi, sashimi, caviar, lobster, and more. But trust me:

Come hungry.
Start with the A5 Wagyu beef‚Äîdon‚Äôt get distracted by other dishes too early.
Stick firmly to your preferred doneness, even if the waiter suggests otherwise.
After trying at least two A5 Wagyu cuts, then go all out on everything else.

Their miso soup is rich and comforting, and the other beef cuts are also delicious. The desserts, though? Honestly, underwhelming‚Äîbland and forgettable.

Service has been consistently excellent on all my visits. Book well in advance‚Äîthis is a rare dining experience. They claim to be the only one of its kind in the country, and I believe it‚ÄîI haven‚Äôt seen anything like this elsewhere. Niku X definitely lived up to the hype. Jerry was our server and he was amazing through our whole experience, start to finish. Very knowledgeable about the menu, both food and drinks and continued to help us pick great options. Daniel (I believe Im remembering his name right) at the host stand was also really nice and very accommodating when our table was taking longer to be ready than our reservation time.

We got the premium menu (priced at $159 pp; recently increased and not properly reflected on their whole website and certain physical menus) which included the seafood buffet and all of the steak cuts.  The steaks were all delicious, from the domestic Wagyu to the delicious JP A5, and the self serve seafood buffet was full enough that everyone could find something to enjoy. They also had restock times for some of the more popular items as well as utensils like seafood scissors and crab crackers which were necessities.

I‚Äôd definitely take some time to consider what you‚Äôre going to want to get and when‚Äîlike getting a buffet plate and enjoying what you got first before ordering some steak‚Äîso you don‚Äôt let certain foods get cold or cross flavors you may not have intended to, which was a slight issue I had figured may (and did) happen, but that didn‚Äôt take away from the food quality.

Great overall experience from the whole staff. I‚Äôd go again simply to enjoy the experience differently, maybe at one of the KBBQ style table grills or just ordering my dinner differently, but if you‚Äôre thinking about giving it a go and/or concerned about the price point, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth your while at least once to see and judge for yourself ! I‚Äôd go again simply to enjoy the experience differently, maybe at one of the KBBQ style table grills or just ordering my dinner differently, but if you‚Äôre thinking about giving it a go and/or concerned about the price point, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth your while at least once to see and judge for yourself ! Niku X definitely lived up to the hype. Jerry was our server and he was amazing through our whole experience, start to finish. Very knowledgeable about the menu, both food and drinks and continued to help us pick great options. Daniel (I believe Im remembering his name right) at the host stand was also really nice and very accommodating when our table was taking longer to be ready than our reservation time.

We got the premium menu (priced at $159 pp; recently increased and not properly reflected on their whole website and certain physical menus) which included the seafood buffet and all of the steak cuts.  The steaks were all delicious, from the domestic Wagyu to the delicious JP A5, and the self serve seafood buffet was full enough that everyone could find something to enjoy. They also had restock times for some of the more popular items as well as utensils like seafood scissors and crab crackers which were necessities.

We‚Äôve been dining at Niku X for the past nine months, and each visit continues to impress. This is easily one of the best high-end dining experiences in Los Angeles.

The A5 Wagyu is the undisputed highlight‚Äîexpertly grilled tableside, incredibly tender, and full of rich flavor. We‚Äôre also big fans of the shrimp and lobster tails‚Äîalways fresh and satisfying. Don‚Äôt miss the Miso Chilean Seabass wrap (ordered separately)‚Äîa buttery, melt-in-your-mouth bite that‚Äôs absolutely worth it.

We first met Cody at the Little Tokyo Chubby Cattle location and were happy to see him here. He always makes us feel welcome‚Äîlike a friend ensuring we enjoy every aspect of the meal. Wilson was our main server and was fantastic throughout‚Äîattentive, professional, and warm.

One note: premium seafood items like king crab and lobster tails are replenished on a schedule. At this price point, continuous availability would be more fitting. Also, pre-shelled lobster tail would improve the overall dining ease.

We‚Äôve been Chubby Club members for a few months now, and it‚Äôs a great value for those who dine here often. Valet parking with validation is currently $24 (up from $16.50 nine months ago), still reasonable considering the regular $54 rate without validation.

Reservations are highly recommended‚Äîuse OpenTable to secure a spot. The dining experience is limited to 120 minutes, so plan accordingly.

Exceptional food, top-tier service, and a sleek, modern ambiance make Niku X a must-try. We‚Äôll absolutely be back. We booked a couple of weeks in advance for a party on Saturday for three adults.  We selected the non BBQ. There were several options for an All You Can Drink to go along with your meal which includes soft  drinks, beers and soju for $20. But honestly how much can you drink with the great selection of options to eat.  All of the meats were good. They came in 5oz and 3oz portions.  Cooked to order.    But you would expect so for $150 per head.  The side options were good.  The seafood was a great accompaniment and for some reason the chilled fruits helped contrast the fatty meats between bites.  The only think I would change if we went next time would be to select the self bbq option.  It was an issue that the smaller meat portions  cooked to order were served on large cold plates.  So when they get to you the wagyu is already on the cold side.  They should have preheated the plates or served on something that was less heat conducting.  Still a good evening but expensive! Especially with the parking on top. Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Reservation Not sure Noise level Moderate noise Wait time No wait

went at 8:15pm on sunday for a birthday. had a reservation at 8:30 and was sat at 8:22. our grill didn‚Äôt initially work and we really wanted that experience, and they promptly moved us. Our server Joe C made this such a wonderful experience. we went with the premium selection and it‚Äôs beyond worth the upcharge. The quality is night and day from what is available at the buffet (although the buffet is very worth it as well!).

There was only a line at 8:45 for the buffet but besides that was able to walk up and grab whatever in seconds. The sashimi was high quality and the cocktail shrimp were delicious! The king crab was (obviously) not as high quality as you‚Äôd find from a la carte king crab, but this was expected and was still very good.

The seabass, a5 ribeye and strip loin were the table favorites. desert was skippable. overall a fantastic meal and worth the cost Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Fine dining experience for sure at Niku X, and a stunning view to enjoy your limitless meat with. Went with the premium $149 option since we didn't want to limit ourselves.

Did the smart thing and avoided the easy carbs / dumplings / rice dishes in bulk and stuck to the protein (miso chilean sea bass, tons of wagyu orders). The ribeye was cut in a strangly thin way, so other cuts like the top sirloin, flank, etc were more enjoyable.

Turns out that wagyu is best consumed in smaller doses - learned that the hard way haha but will be back! For a whole restaurant chain known to focus on Japanese Waygu, Niku X is supposed to be one of their flagships. To that end they deliver on the vibe and experience, but the food is rougher.

Overall the buffet is high quality, but the Waygu options, at least on the regular buffet menu, are decidedly meh - they have other Chubby Group restaurant brands that do a better job for the money. If you go for the higher end menu the experience is likely better but then you‚Äôre even more of a premium. Combined with the fact that reservations are so hard to get and I am decidedly meh.

Final note, service is indeed excellent, and Joe, our server, was terrific. The atmosphere is nice, very dim in the restaurant with a small lamp at your table. Might be hard to see for those with vision impairments. We visited Niku x in between Christmas and New Year's. Perfect timing. Went right when they opened. Made a reservation about a month in advance but at that time you didn't need one. The atmosphere was really good but not what I expected for the price.

The buffet food was plentiful and had great flavors. Lots of crab legs, limited Sushi but lots of things you could order from a menu that were included in your meal price.

The service was fantastic. Our server was wonderful. She gave us lots of tips on what to order from the menu and how to order from the menu. If you are celebrating a birthday, great place to go and always ask for a slushie at the end. That was the best surprise of the evening.

The slices of wagyu beef are one to two bites. You can get as much wagyu beef as you like. However, they do have a 30% waste fee if they see that you are taking more food than you can eat.

It was a nice experience and gift for my family for Christmas. Special occasions I would go again. Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

LArge venue in a cool area, just above the street with a view of the streets of downtown. When you enter, the Host area is right by the buffet line, which can cause some congestion for those looking to grab their bites. The line itself is crammed on one side of a walkway which also leads to other dining areas, the restroom and the service entrance to the kitchen.
The rest of the venue is spacious and comfortable.
The line starts with a selection of apps, with sushi, ceviche and other items. It follows by a selection of raw Wagyu beef, then ending with the 'premium' seafood selection. While the apps and Wagyu selections were fresh and tasty, the seafood selections were nothing to be desired, tasting 'cheap' in comparison to the other options.

Service was on point! I had a server named Joe C, with another server helping named Wilson, always available or visible when needed but not overwhelmingly. The servers brought out additional meats that were cooked to perfection right at the table, with a detailed explanation of each type and the best way to enjoy with various sauces. Staff kept up with table maintenance, always asking to clear instead of removing dishes in a hurry. We did not feel rushed and felt that the servers did pay proper attention to service rather than the 'flip and dip' service of many area restaurants. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Tomahawk Wagyu, Tomahawk Steak, Miso Chilean Sea Bass, Miso Soup, Wagyu Sukiyaki

I found out about this spot through a YouTube video & it looked like a great restaurant.  Just be aware to make a reservation you have to put down a deposit, which I did(cost depending on your party size).  There are different types of tables too(a la carte, tasting & others) & I chose the Yakiniku tasting.

First off it‚Äôs an expensive spot, if you just want to get full on meat, you can go to my favorite spot, Quarters KBBQ in Koreatown. This spot is more of an elaborate presentation & elevated dining experience. The decor and interior overall was solid & I wish I could of toured the whole location.

The tasting was absolutely phenomenal, but If I had to do it all over again, I think I would have went for the Tomahawk upgrade. I sat in an area without a view, which would have been something I‚Äôd recommend in getting to fully enjoy the experience. Also I forgot to get a good glass of red wine to pair with the offerings. The bar area was solid & I wonder if you can just walk in for just the bar area.

Each dish was carefully crafted and made to joyfully amuse your tastebuds. The meats were so fresh, seasoned perfectly & probably the best I‚Äôve ever had, but at a cost. There is so much more to explore on their menu, like their Wagyu bone Marrow, other entrees & desserts.

I‚Äôd definitely come back again to try their tomahawk offering.  Once I try their best option & get a better view of the spot, than I can justify a full 5 stars(will take a while because I got to recoup some funds lol).  The customer service though is without a doubt excellent and deserving of a 5 because they cater to a lot of the needs you had as a customer.

Just be aware it‚Äôs valet mainly or discounted parking but not free.  I walked to this spot to avoid the parking hoopla. Enjoy the spot & yolo responsibly!

***updated***
Recently did the Wagyu Tomahawk Tasting and it was phenomenal, just check out the pictures and videos. Originally I rated this spot four stars for their sushi mainly but after this tomahawk experience, it‚Äôs now a full 5 stars.

***Update***
I tried their $150 all you can eat wagyu buffet with seafood and lobster with my parents. It was phenomenal and thanks to Kelly our server for an excellent experience.

My warning to you is eat to be satisfied and don‚Äôt go overboard otherwise they will charge you for wasting food. Luckily my parents and I ate it all but I should have stopped a few plates ago. The Wagyu quality was top notch and the menu items were excellent.

For the price it‚Äôs worth it and I would say pace yourself. I recently dined at Niku X and had a positive experience overall. The wagyu was fantastic, the seafood was mostly very delicious, and the sides that you order from the kitchen were all very good as well. Being a huge seafood fan, I was primarily interested in eating the various fish and shellfish options. While I really enjoyed 90% of the seafood selection, I will say that the crab and lobster were a bit underwhelming. One of the crabs (can't remember which kind) was very salty, while the lobster had a somewhat rubbery texture. Aside from the seafood, the beef options were all fantastic and melt-in-your-mouth. The cocktails were well-made and delicious, but seemed light on alcohol. We also ordered a couple of soft drinks, which were fairly expensive and not a good value ($6 for a tiny glass bottle of Coke). The service was very good throughout the entire dining experience and I was impressed that the servers came to change our grill often without us asking. The primary reason I am taking off a star from my review is that our server essentially bribed us into giving him a good review on Yelp by offering to comp our soft drinks. I assumed that meant we could write him a good review on our own terms, but instead he took our phones, copied and pasted an AI-generated review on Yelp, and asked us to post it. It was honestly quite uncomfortable and it makes me question how legitimate the other reviews are for this establishment. Just something to be aware of. Otherwise, I really enjoyed the meal and would recommend Niku X to other seafood and wagyu lovers. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Miso Chilean Sea Bass, Wagyu Tartare

**BEWARE**
If you're going for the buffet, make sure you make a reservation if possible! Otherwise, you'll end up sitting at the bar and obligated to take the $139 option (that's what happened to my group of 4), And me being someone who doesn't love seafood, the $139 option is overpriced for me. But honestly, I think it was the better experience, even though it was our first time there and we missed out on being able to cook our own food. The bartenders Joseph (and I forgot the other guys name... sorry üò¨) were awesome! They were so attentive and helpful in the food selection process. On top of that, they were great conversationalists and artists of concoctions. Even the other staff members that crossed our path were really cool. It was like we sat in the VIP area and were the only ones there! üòÇ All the food was delicious and there were many top notch meat selections. The sea bass is a MUST try! üíãüëåüèº The vibe is casual but classy. (Heads up, though, they only play K-Pop so if you go I hope you're either a fan or don't mind.) It was an experience and I would definitely go back! There will be other unknowing patrons parked there but you can't, we verified directly with parking enforcement that just happened to pull up literally after we parked and had JUST exited the SUV to go to the restaurant. Just valet your vehicle. With validation from the restaurant, it's not a terrible fee.

I went to Niku X for the second time last night. I requested Wilson L. for my server because he gave us top-notch service the 1st time we ever visited. I brought back my family and it was a fantastic night. I read and saw some recent reviews on both IG and YT complaining that they were left hungry and servers deliberately withheld food for long periods of time or wouldn't refill the buffet. I absolutely did not see any of that the entire two hours I ate there.

Our server Wilson always made sure to check on us frequently and make sure our orders came out in a timely manner. If there was a little wait on any item, he always came to let us know immediately and asked if we wanted anything else. However we never waited too long for anything and we had a delicious and fantastic meal. Also I never saw the buffet empty like some reviewers said. There always was a refill on food and honestly it was worth every penny to dine here.

There are so many things available in our $139 buffet that honestly 1 trip and even 2 trips is not enough to try out the entire menu. There are still menu items we have not tried because we got full early on. I don't understand why one YouTuber complained that he spent $140 for buffet but was still hungry afterwards because they didn't refill his food or fulfill most of his orders on time. We never experienced any of that both times we dined. And we felt the food was fantastic. But you have to try to see what you like. I didn't really like the sushi and sashimi platter from the $140 buffet menubut I enjoyed the sashimi that was in the buffet line instead. I thought the oxtail potstickers were average but all of their Wagyu Beef absolutely delicious and amazing. I could go on and on but you really need to try and what find what you like. Most of what is offered is absolutely delicious.
I plan on coming back to celebrate more special occasions here. Thank you Niku X and to our server Wilson for making our night at Niku X a fantastic and relaxing experience with lots of delicious food memories! A must try experience - great quality meat and seafood!

Booked full service for 2 ($139pp) on a Thursday night. Arrived a few minutes late due to LA traffic - NikuX is located in the same building as the Intercontinental hotel in DTLA, on the second floor. Seated within 5 minutes in a nice window seat.

With the full-service menu, you get to order unlimited amounts of everything on the menu and some special items once.

Unlimited items: some items require preparation and you need to order the day before your reservation, such as the 45-day aged tomahawk - which we ordered. When we sat down, we immediately ordered Japanese A5 ribeye and tenderloin.

What we liked:
- Japanese A5 steaks - sliced thin, good quality, not a lot in each serving but because of the heavy fat content it fills you up quickly!
- Wagyu fried rice - whoever is working the wok on the rice is doing a great job!
- Unlimited lobster tails and king crab legs at the buffet - served chilled on ice, but supplied with lemons and butter and very fresh. And they‚Äôve cut the lobster tails in half to make it even easier to eat.
- Miso Sea bass - served in ‚Äúcubes‚Äù that were pan fried and served on a skewer. Very tasty

Not fans of:
- Shishito pepper

The special items (limited to one per person)
- Sashimi special - uni, toro, salmon, caviar - what‚Äôs not to like? Very tasty. Small portion but it was very good. I had both portions for the two of us that went‚Ä¶yum!
- King crab stuffed - served hot - very good
- Big head shrimp - served hot - also very good

Buffet - shrimp, other wagyu food options, like curry, fresh salad, vegetables, tempura - all unlimited and self-serve. Good selection.

Cocktails / wine - expansive menu - prices are about what you would expect for LA prices.

Service - Wissal was our server - very friendly - informative and professional. Thanks for a great time! In terms of the food service, honestly it was a bit slow. I know you get 2 hours to eat but we often sat 15-20 minutes with no steak despite ordering. That would probably be my only point of negative feedback. Quality was great. We left super full - but the long lag times to get cooked steak out on the full-service option was a bit disappointing. Next time, I might skip the full service and just get the self-service and cook my own meat over a Korean BBQ and take the wagyu they had at the buffet.

Now - if you make it to the end and you still have room for dessert - you can try it. Their tiny dessert station didn‚Äôt have anything great in my opinion. We tried a few things and were underwhelmed. But hey - we were already bursting at the seams from all the Wagyu :)

A must try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Fried Rice, King Crab and Snow Crab Legs, Premium Seafood, Tomahawk Wagyu

A must try experience - great quality meat and seafood!

Booked full service for 2 ($139pp) on a Thursday night. Arrived a few minutes late due to LA traffic - NikuX is located in the same building as the Intercontinental hotel in DTLA, on the second floor. Seated within 5 minutes in a nice window seat.

With the full-service menu, you get to order unlimited amounts of everything on the menu and some special items once.

Unlimited items: some items require preparation and you need to order the day before your reservation, such as the 45-day aged tomahawk - which we ordered. When we sat down, we immediately ordered Japanese A5 ribeye and tenderloin.

What we liked:
- Japanese A5 steaks - sliced thin, good quality, not a lot in each serving but because of the heavy fat content it fills you up quickly!
- Wagyu fried rice - whoever is working the wok on the rice is doing a great job!
- Unlimited lobster tails and king crab legs at the buffet - served chilled on ice, but supplied with lemons and butter and very fresh. And they‚Äôve cut the lobster tails in half to make it even easier to eat.
- Miso Sea bass - served in ‚Äúcubes‚Äù that were pan fried and served on a skewer. Very tasty

Not fans of:
- Shishito pepper

The special items (limited to one per person)
- Sashimi special - uni, toro, salmon, caviar - what‚Äôs not to like? Very tasty. Small portion but it was very good. I had both portions for the two of us that went‚Ä¶yum!
- King crab stuffed - served hot - very good
- Big head shrimp - served hot - also very good

Buffet - shrimp, other wagyu food options, like curry, fresh salad, vegetables, tempura - all unlimited and self-serve. Good selection.

Cocktails / wine - expansive menu - prices are about what you would expect for LA prices.

Service - Wissal was our server - very friendly - informative and professional. Thanks for a great time! In terms of the food service, honestly it was a bit slow. I know you get 2 hours to eat but we often sat 15-20 minutes with no steak despite ordering. That would probably be my only point of negative feedback. Quality was great. We left super full - but the long lag times to get cooked steak out on the full-service option was a bit disappointing. Next time, I might skip the full service and just get the self-service and cook my own meat over a Korean BBQ and take the wagyu they had at the buffet.

Now - if you make it to the end and you still have room for dessert - you can try it. Their tiny dessert station didn‚Äôt have anything great in my opinion. We tried a few things and were underwhelmed. But hey - we were already bursting at the seams from all the Wagyu :)

Beautiful restaurant with excellent service, and the food was well worth the price! We opted for the VIP treatment where you didn't have to cook your own food.  Their American wagyu and Japanese A5 were to die for, so delicious and tender! This alone made it worth the trip! And then there's the  Raw oysters and sashimi which were super fresh! Their snow crab legs and lobster tails were so so good dipped in their lemon garlic butter sauce. Chilean sea bass was very tasty and cooked perfectly. I will say that I had a couple items I tried that didn't quite satisfy, but I still give this place 5 stars because the food I did eat most of were GREAT AND THE SERVICE was AMAZING. Thank you Mikey!  One of the things I wasn't too happy with lamb lollipop, which lasted much flavor. Another was the tomahawk steak because some of it was a little tough and didn't compare to the A5 tenderloin.  But then again, nothing compared to the A5 Tenderloin, IMO.  Also, they didn't have too much of a dessert selection.  We had a 9:15 pm reservation, so it's likely we came too late to enjoy a spread of sweets. But since I was so stuffed with all the unbelievably good food, I didn't mind skipping dessert. All in all, I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go again! Had a reservation for 2 for Niku X on Friday night at 9:30 PM. Niku X is located in the Wilshire-Grand Building on the 2nd floor on the opposite side of the Intercontinenal Hotel. Found street parking on Figueroa & 6th. We took the escalators up and were about 20 minutes early, we were greeted by the hostess and led to the waiting area and given a drinks menu. Originally our reservation was for the $99 option but we decided to do the $139 instead (unfortunately we did not get to do the tomahawk that is part of the $139 option as we needed to preorder by 1:30 PM). We waited about 5 minutes and were led to our giant table with a grill in the center. Mikey introduced himself to us as our server and he was cool, friendly and very attentive along with the other staff.

To start off there is the self-serve buffet style salad bar (NIKU salad, mushrooms & zucchini for grilling, seafood salad, kimchi, fruit), then the crudo bar (wagyu tartare, bluefin tuna toro w/ scallion, salmon, A5 wagyu tartare, amberjack, halibut, scallop, ceviche), then the hot foods (white rice topped with furikake, wagyu curry, wagyu mapo tofu, fried veggies, shrimp tempura and then the meat locker (Japanese A5 chef's choice steak, Japanese A5 top sirloin, American Wagyu Ribeye, American Wagyu Striploin, American Wagyu Tenderloin) and then the chilled seafood (oysters, scallops, lobster tail, snow crab legs & king crab legs) and the condiments (lemon, cajun butter, pink peppercorn mignonette & yuzu cocktail sauce) and lastly a small dessert section.

There were items on the menu that you had to order through your server. We tried the potato pave, oxtail potstickers, A5 wagyu sando, miso Chilean sea bass, wagyu tallow shishito peppers, wagyu sukiyaki, and lamb lollipop. Because of the $139 option we were each allowed to order 1 item from the Chef's Special Seafood so we chose the ultimate sashimi platter (assorted sashimi, uni, foie gras, caviar) and sushi platter which was incredible. The quality of fish was very fresh, each piece of sushi was dabbed with a little sauce/tare and the slightly acidic vinegar rice was perfect and really opened up the appetite.

The meat what can I say? Every single piece melted in the mouth, after a slight sear on both sides of the beef and got great maillard reaction. You can season your meat with the condiments at the table  (salt, pepper, chili powder, wasabi salt, house blend, truffle salt). Our favorites were definitely the Japanese cuts, they were VERY rich and a little goes a long way but it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout being able to enjoy small dishes of quality seafood from the crudo bar or some salad  in between the rich meat and most definitely the seafood... not many places offer king crab legs so this is legit, crab crackers and crab shears provided as well, the crab meat were both so naturally sweet with a bit of brininess from the salt water, id say the crab legs alone make it worth it, just go to Costco and take a look at the cooked red king crab legs. I didn't try any of the desserts or hot food items except for the wagyu fried rice and shrimp tempura but I'll definitely be back to enjoy the full experience, hopefully with an earlier reservation time.

Also, this is a restaurant part of the Chubby Group (Chubby Cattle, Chubby Curry, Wagyu House, Yumiyaki, Mikiya, Chubby Skewers) so make sure you get the app and points! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Premium Seafood, King Crab and Snow Crab Legs, Oxtail Pot Stickers

Originally our reservation was for the $99 option but we decided to do the $139 instead (unfortunately we did not get to do the tomahawk that is part of the $139 option as we needed to preorder by 1:30 PM). We waited about 5 minutes and were led to our giant table with a grill in the center. Mikey introduced himself to us as our server and he was cool, friendly and very attentive along with the other staff.

To start off there is the self-serve buffet style salad bar (NIKU salad, mushrooms & zucchini for grilling, seafood salad, kimchi, fruit), then the crudo bar (wagyu tartare, bluefin tuna toro w/ scallion, salmon, A5 wagyu tartare, amberjack, halibut, scallop, ceviche), then the hot foods (white rice topped with furikake, wagyu curry, wagyu mapo tofu, fried veggies, shrimp tempura and then the meat locker (Japanese A5 chef's choice steak, Japanese A5 top sirloin, American Wagyu Ribeye, American Wagyu Striploin, American Wagyu Tenderloin) and then the chilled seafood (oysters, scallops, lobster tail, snow crab legs & king crab legs) and the condiments (lemon, cajun butter, pink peppercorn mignonette & yuzu cocktail sauce) and lastly a small dessert section.

There were items on the menu that you had to order through your server. We tried the potato pave, oxtail potstickers, A5 wagyu sando, miso Chilean sea bass, wagyu tallow shishito peppers, wagyu sukiyaki, and lamb lollipop. Because of the $139 option we were each allowed to order 1 item from the Chef's Special Seafood so we chose the ultimate sashimi platter (assorted sashimi, uni, foie gras, caviar) and sushi platter which was incredible. The quality of fish was very fresh, each piece of sushi was dabbed with a little sauce/tare and the slightly acidic vinegar rice was perfect and really opened up the appetite.

The meat what can I say? Every single piece melted in the mouth, after a slight sear on both sides of the beef and got great maillard reaction. You can season your meat with the condiments at the table  (salt, pepper, chili powder, wasabi salt, house blend, truffle salt). Our favorites were definitely the Japanese cuts, they were VERY rich and a little goes a long way but it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout being able to enjoy small dishes of quality seafood from the crudo bar or some salad  in between the rich meat and most definitely the seafood... not many places offer king crab legs so this is legit, crab crackers and crab shears provided as well, the crab meat were both so naturally sweet with a bit of brininess from the salt water, id say the crab legs alone make it worth it, just go to Costco and take a look at the cooked red king crab legs. I didn't try any of the desserts or hot food items except for the wagyu fried rice and shrimp tempura but I'll definitely be back to enjoy the full experience, hopefully with an earlier reservation time.

Also, this is a restaurant part of the Chubby Group (Chubby Cattle, Chubby Curry, Wagyu House, Yumiyaki, Mikiya, Chubby Skewers) so make sure you get the app and points! We visited Niku X for their new lobster and wagyu seafood buffet yesterday, and it was fantastic! Even before the doors opened, there was already a line, which shows how popular it is.

The buffet offers two price options, $99 and $139, both worth it for the unlimited lobster, A5 wagyu, oysters, and king crab legs. The food was fresh and delicious, and there's also a variety of hot dishes, sashimi, and desserts--including cakes from a collaboration with Freesia bakery.

A highlight was the Yakitsuki, cooked fresh and melting in your mouth, though it's limited to one per person. The chef's specials, like miso Chilean sea bass and wagyu sando, were also outstanding.

The service was attentive, and the atmosphere elegant yet cozy. If you're a lobster lover, this buffet is a must-try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Tartare

I had a fantastic experience at Niku X on Monday evening. The food was absolutely top-notch! The quality of the meat was undeniable ‚Äì incredibly flavorful and cooked to perfection.  It was clear they use only the finest ingredients.

The atmosphere at the restaurant was lovely, but what truly made the night unforgettable was the exceptional service. The bar lead, a tall gentleman with a beard (sorry, I can't recall his name!), was incredibly knowledgeable and engaging.

His expertise went far beyond just drinks. He was passionate about the history of the menu items, especially the fascinating details  about how the meat was aged and prepared.  He also had an impressive understanding of mezcal and other beverages, making fantastic recommendations that perfectly complemented our meal.

Thanks to this exceptional staff member, my experience  was  unforgettable,  and I'm already planning my next visit.  If you're looking for a fantastic meal and exceptional service, this is the place to go! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $50‚Äì100 Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Unless you‚Äôre vegetarian, you will love your experience at Niku X. They have beautiful aesthetics and a high attention to detail. The interior architecture is modern and elegant, while the decorations and food presentation compliment these themes. The staff are very kind, though one of them acted a bit informal. Our server was very friendly, which I love in a course meal, being able to chat with them during the experience. The only downside of the space is that the restaurant was playing upbeat music which was loud. It was a bit bothersome and was hard to hear the servers explaining each course.
Onto the food, I highly recommend the course meals because these are experiences designed from beginning to last and they give you a full experience. I chose the lower priced menu because the starters felt more appealing, and they definitely hit the spot. All the dishes throughout the night are very rich, overflowing with umami flavors from ingredients like truffle, Wagyu, and egg yolk. At the same time, the chefs at Niku X know to pair these fatty beef cuts with acidic garnishes like lemon and ume, which helps balance out the intensity. I can nitpick a few things, but that is after understanding that the whole meal was amazing. With the tenderloin, they present it on a small, soft slice of bread and this portion was hard to eat without it all falling apart. The sukiyaki had a whole shiso leaf with it to eat, and that was overbearing over the rest of the ingredients.
If you are looking for a premium dinner experience, definitely look to Niku X to be pampered with an incredibly enjoyable night. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Recommended dishes

Everyone should dine here at least once if from out of town and make this a regular spot if local. It was an awesome experience. Will def be back for the tomahawk experience as we did a la carte from having a lengthy food tour earlier in the day. We ordered essentially small plates to try and touch and go on different parts of the menu.

Got some wagyu tallow potato pave. That dipping sauce is incredible. Caviar, uni tartare is definitely a greatest hit for them, must order item. Ocean plate added a nice twist despite it being wagyu-centric resto. The fish, scallop and clam tasted fresh and that beurre blank is citrusy and on point. Roasted bone marrow is a nice visual with them lighting it on fire tableside. Definitely order this one per person. Rich and unctuous, so good. Would love to have brought it home for my dog, but im from SF. The wagyu donabe reminded me of bibimbap, would be dope if yall had a sizzling stone pot version!

Olivia I think was our waiter, she was incredible. Friendly, outgoing and attentive. The vibes, resto, ambiance and staff were all perfect! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Tartare

This place was AMAZING! We came at the end of their soft opening. The restaurant was so well designed and the ambiance was perfect for a high end dining experience. Each table and booth felt cozy and private and it is such a great vibe for a date night or friends night out. The service was perfect too! Our waiter Wes made great conversation and took great care of us.

We did the tasting menu and each dish/course really blew our mind. All the meats were juicy and tender and had amazing flavor to it whether is was pre marinated or we dipped in their special sauce. The presentation of all the foods was on point and I loved all the palette cleansers they brought out in between.

The ending with the donabe was perfect and the dessert really helped tie the whole tasting experience together.

We can‚Äôt wait to come back and try their tomahawk steak! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+

Niku X is the premier date spot and dinner experience. I can't recommend it enough. I took my girlfriend here as a part of a larger anniversary weekend and we both thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We both are already wanting to go back!

We did the tasting menu, which was coursed out over 2 hours or so. Additionally, we ordered some a la carte items and drinks (they now have their liquor license, which I had seen some recent reviews saying they didn't yet).

Food:

The first course was sashimi, which was actually one of favorites. The fish was so fresh and it had some jelly on top, which added a next level of flavor to the dish. We then were served our a la carte items, which were the wagyu bone marrow and 1000 layer potato. The wagyu bone marrow is a must! The bread alone is worth it, but the bone marrow itself is the best I have had.

The caviar, uni, and wagyu dish seems excessive from the extent that it is so many luxury items together in one dish, though it is amazing. It genuinely tastes like something out of this world. The uni was so fresh and the caviar was the perfect balance of flavor and saltiness. Together with the side items that are served with the dish, it is complemented really well.

The wagyu tray of various cuts of meats is the star of the show, both according to visuals and taste. The cuts of meat are all cooked and served by the waitstaff, which are explained in detail. Each piece was somehow better than the last.

the final course of a5 wagyu on toast with blueberry jam and foie gras, was good, but I think ti could have been a little better. I think the flavors complemented each other very well, but knowing how a5 tastes by itself, it made me wanting more out of the dish a little. I wanted to taste the richness of the meat and I though that was lacking from the dish. The dish itself was great, but it felt like deep down I was missing something, since I know all of the ingredients separately.

Drinks:

The Matcha Colada was great, especially if you like matcha. It was fresh matcha and definitely blended well with the coconut. I would recommend it for matcha lovers.

The margarita was probably one of the best margaritas that I have had ANYWHERE in LA. It was that good. Definitely a 10/10 for me.

Ume Raba was good, but my 3rd ranked from the bunch. It was refereshing, but not really my style.

As a bonus, they serve oolong tea as a palette cleanser mid-meal, which was great. I will unashamedly admit I had 4 cups of tea.

Dessert:

Matcha dessert was super rich, but delicious. I liked it a lot. It was similar to a matcha ice cream, with powdered matcha around it. My girlfriend thought the matcha flavor was too rich, though I thought it was perfect.

The creme br√ªl√©e was the better of the two dishes as was the textbook definition of an ideal dessert in my opinion. Only only downside is that it is pretty small.

Service:

Service was tip tier, like you would find in a Michelin restaurant. The servers were knowledgeable and friendly, especially about the dishes and what they were preparing for us.

Overall:

The food was all top tier and I have no doubt that this place will receive a Michelin Star in the near future. If someone asked me what I wanted to eat every day for the rest of my life, it would be this place. I would happily do so.

I now dream to do the tomahawk experience next. Hopefully sometime soon. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Valet parking at the Interncontinental hotel, which came out to $16.50

I tried the Yakiniku Testing Menu. All the appetizers were delicious, with fresh and high-quality ingredients. Even the soup and salad were very particular. The waiters were very professional and humorous in grilling, and they would explain each dish one by one. The special Japanese charcoal grill was a big plus. The grilled meat items were a bit greasy, but the Jinxuan tea was just enough to relieve the greasiness and make you want to come back to try other dishes!

This big, industrial atrium is almost hidden within the intercontinental hotel in DTLA, so it‚Äôs got a bit of a speakeasy vibe as you enter, then suddenly you‚Äôre met with high ceilings, grand murals & larger than life art as well as little kitty robots zipping around; a nod to Tokyo I assume. Once seated, we were greeted first with caviar & beef tartare topped with the smoothest uni I‚Äôve ever eaten. The seasonal tasting menu was A+ Michelin worthy from start to finish. While the staff seemed a little nervous at times, I could tell it was from their desire to make sure all was presented perfectly & things came from kitchen to table in a timely fashion. I have to say: from the consomm√©‚Äôs deep umami broth, the brightness of their lobster sashimi, the grandiose delivery & table-side grilling of the fresh trout & ALL the incredible meats from Australia, US & Japan, I‚Äôm very happy I came. Is it funny that the jidori egg dipping sauce left the biggest impression? It‚Äôs a must try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Parking They offer validation for discounted parking. Wheelchair accessibility There are elevators to and from the restaurant to the parking.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Parking: They offer validation for discounted parking.
Wheelchair accessibility: There are elevators to and from the restaurant to the parking.

Niku X is not to be missed!
If you are looking for the highest quality dishes, a beautiful layout, or a secluded private room for a party or event -- this is the quintessential place to go. It‚Äôs like no other.

The moment you walk through their doors you are immediately greeted with a view of an immense kitchen, curated by Michelin Star Chef Shin Thompson. You can watch your meal being carefully prepared. It‚Äôs stunning.

Our fantastic waiter Chaeho did a phenomenal job presenting each elegant dish and conversing with us throughout our meal. We felt at home with his personal stories and interesting insights. Our superb assistant waitress, Phoebe, who helped bring out some of the dishes was very professional and sweet. The entire staff at this restaurant are top quality professionals.

Our first course, crudo, was very fresh and a perfect start to our meal. The astrea oscietra caviar, paired with senbei cracker and topped with gold leaf was astounding and a treat to the taste buds. I have never had such a beautiful visual as well as sensory moment. There was no heaviness, only pleasure with each bite. The black winter truffle was presented in a Louis Vuitton mini suitcase, and shaved onto the meat. Now I know what it feels like to be presented with an award!

The style and story behind each plate reflected the precision and passion of the kitchen. It‚Äôs obvious that the staff love what they do. I felt as though I was in an edible art gallery; the balance of texture and color was so artistic.

My favorite dish was the wagu platter, not just for the breathtaking display, but each cut of meat touched my tongue with intense flavor. To continue the journey, every course had a different palate cleanser with its own sensation.

The price is worth the entire experience. It is very special and one of a kind unique. I recommend it for an exceptional date night, or a gathering. I will never forget it. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+

NIKU X is a must try! We first heard about NIKU X on TikTok and realized that we've been to one of their sister companies, Chubby Cattle in Las Vegas. If you haven't been, it is also a must try when you're in sin city!

Located on the 2nd floor of the Intercontinental hotel. You won't get lost, there's a bunch of signs telling you where to go via escalator or elevator.

We got the Yakiniku Tasting Menu which includes appetizers, yakiniku, and dessert. Every dish was very decadent and umami from start to finish -- the uni, caviar and wagyu tartare dish to the different types of wagyu from the US, Australia, and Japan. You'll leave wanting more of the toriyama sandwich with foie gras and milk bread.

Besides the food, the vibe and the service by Mama J was phenomenal - she was funny and also attentive to make our experience one-of-a-kind. Thanks again for the lovely service and delicious food. We will be back soon to try out the Tomahawk Tasting Menu! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Located on the 2nd floor at the Intercontinental Hotel. You have the option to valet or self-park. NIKU X will validate your parking at a discounted rate.

Service: Dine in
Meal type: Dinner
Price per person: $100+
Parking: Located on the 2nd floor at the Intercontinental Hotel. You have the option to valet or self-park. NIKU X will validate your parking at a discounted rate.

NIKU X is a must try! We first heard about NIKU X on TikTok and realized that we've been to one of their sister companies, Chubby Cattle in Las Vegas. If you haven't been, it is also a must try when you're in sin city!

Located on the 2nd floor of the Intercontinental hotel. You won't get lost, there's a bunch of signs telling you where to go via escalator or elevator.

We got the Yakiniku Tasting Menu which includes appetizers, yakiniku, and dessert. Every dish was very decadent and umami from start to finish -- the uni, caviar and wagyu tartare dish to the different types of wagyu from the US, Australia, and Japan. You'll leave wanting more of the toriyama sandwich with foie gras and milk bread.

Besides the food, the vibe and the service by Mama J was phenomenal - she was funny and also attentive to make our experience one-of-a-kind. Thanks again for the lovely service and delicious food. We will be back soon to try out the Tomahawk Tasting Menu! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Located on the 2nd floor at the Intercontinental Hotel. You have the option to valet or self-park. NIKU X will validate your parking at a discounted rate.

What an experience!!! Had the pleasure of enjoying the tasting menu at Niku X. The menu items were curated nicely. We were greeted with welcoming smiles and seated promptly even thought we arrived a little early for our reservation. The staff was very accommodating and informative of the experience, menu items and aging process of the meat. The way the staff moved around and made things happen felt so "top secret" and movie-like.. I absolutely loved the vibe.
The food was literally works of art presented on platters. Just picture perfect and indulgent at the same time. The food was wonderful, rich and again a well planned adventure. I LOVE that some of our humongous (and delicious) steak was used to prepare our fried rice later in the meal. Some of my favorite dishes were the salad, oxtail wontons, 16 layer potato stack and the Bone marrow. (That's like everything lol)
Oh and PLEASE slather your steak in the egg sauce ... AH-mazing!! (I poured a bit over my fried rice too)
If you are up for a foodie adventure, definitely visit Niku X.  Perfect for a special occasion as well!
There were other items I wanted to try on the menu but the portions on the tasting menu were perfectly filling.
I Will definitely return sooner than later cause I had my eye on the Uni caviar dish!

Plenty of self parking in the parking garage or just valet at the Hotel. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner

I highly recommend Niku X for a special occasion or just a delicious dinner out. Service Dine in Price per person $50‚Äì100

Negative.Context:
Over rated, over priced, and such a huge disappointing. This was supposed to be the highlight of our trip to LA. Instead it became the worst part of it.
We sat at a table without a grill - meaning our food was to be prepped by a chef and delivered to us instead of us cooking it ourselves (Korean bbq style). What I thought this meant was the food would be prepped to perfection and our service would be a lot better since the price difference was $50 per person. Instead we got cooked meat delivered to us cold, the slowest service I have ever seen at any restaurant, and pretty much the worst experience I have had in a very very long time. Every single time we ordered meat it came to our table cold. But because wagyu is so high in fat, the fat didn‚Äôt ‚Äúmelt in our mouth‚Äù it felt like we were chewing sticks of butter/lard. Dish after dish came this way. I was nearly about to lose my mind until we finally decided that we were both just done and ready to leave. That made me feel a lot better to just give up on the experience and decide to escape the place entirely.  The manager came by and asked if we were doing ok but it was only by the time we were about to ask for our check after the entire horrendous experience and leave. So he was too late. Nothing really happened after he heard about our experience. He said sorry and that he hoped he could make it right but we only had one more serving of meat left from our earlier order so there was really nothing he could have done except maybe make sure the last two tiny portions of meat don‚Äôt come out stone cold.
Their buffet food was very low quality, the service was super slow, and the price was really too high for what you get.
Anyways, I highly recommend skipping this place and I‚Äôm really not sure how they have such high ratings. They do seem to have a strong social media presence. Maybe that has something to do with it. Please just beware and don‚Äôt get disappointed like we did! Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 4

Food: 1
Service: 1
Atmosphere: 4

Your restaurant is an embarrassment of an establishment. You ruined my birthday, a party of 12, by losing aka ‚Äúnever receiving‚Äù my reservation. I made the reservation a week and a half before. We spoke twice over the phone about the menu, how I would receive a call 24 hours before the reservation, menu options, how I would need to choose a specific menu so that we could be sat cohesively together, my number, email‚Ä¶ there is no excuse. My friend wrote a review on how poorly handled the conversation went hours before our arrival when we called to see what was going on. You told him you would follow up, even made us send you evidence of our calls which is really quite embarrassing not only on treatment on our part as a special occasion, but also on the lack of professionalism on your part on what is supposed to be a fine dining establishment. It is clear you are nothing of a sort as you never even contacted me and I am here to let the charade you put on that you take care of your customers post terrible experiences is false. You ruined my birthday, and now you are ruining your own reputation. I will be contacting the Better Business Bureau as well as the local media for how terribly this was handled. The only good thing about this place is service. The food is not very good. We paid $655 + tip for a meal for family of four that I will remember as a waste of money. The food was all cheap quality and unsatisfactory. If you are truly a foodie, this place is not for you. Food is bland and flavorless. Best way to describe it you meet a woman on dating app she is very photogenic and you have great conversations over the phone, so you plan this amazing date but when you see her in real life the pictures dont match and the in person communication is dull and boring. At the end of it you just go home sad and alone. Food: 1 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 1

I‚Äôve spent  $250 per person and didn‚Äôt worth it ($150 for the course plus two non-alcoholic beverages)..

Despite the The food is excellent‚Äîpremium Wagyu like Toriyama and delicious crab‚Äîand the staff is kind, Unfortunately, the overall experience doesn‚Äôt justify the price.
The ambience is too crowded, with dirty floors and utensils, and buffet trays often sit empty too long. I‚Äôve ordered a bottle of water and then the staff refilled my glass with water from the jar without noticing that I have a bottle , and the serrated knives provided aren‚Äôt fit for cutting fine Wagyu. For $250, you can enjoy a far better dinner in a refined setting. I honestly don‚Äôt understand why this place was so full. This was our third visit to Niku X and what used to be a place we went for special occasions is no longer. I have recommended to so many friends and family members for their special occasions as well. Last night my wife and I celebrated our anniversary and left extremely disappointed. The service and staff were friendly and attentive and our server Emily was great. However, the new buffet style ruins the atmosphere that once was and the experience is just not the same. We ordered the tomahawk tasting menu and requested our steak medium-rare. When it came out and the server sliced it the inside was cold and the steak was practically purple. We are not the type to send something back, but we swallowed our embarrassment and notified the server. Both the server and manager were both extremely apologetic and agreed that the steak should have not been sent out like that. We were told we would get a new steak, but instead the same sliced steak was just put back on the grill so each piece became tough and chewy and lacked flavor. Not what you would expect when you pay $300+ for a steak and $450 for a meal. Unfortunately we don‚Äôt plan to be back and will no longer be recommending this restaurant to our friends and family. Food: 1 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 2

Atmosphere: 2

That said, the experience wasn‚Äôt as enjoyable as we hoped. The server didn‚Äôt explain anything or walk us through the menu. I even mentioned that it was our first time, but we were still left totally confused about how it all worked. Instead of helping or offering any recommendations, he just kept pushing the potstickers and asked if we wanted rice because it would ‚Äúgo well‚Äù with what we already had. Since he kept suggesting the potstickers, we figured we‚Äôd give them a try‚Äîbut they never even came.

I ordered the Yakisuki thinking it‚Äôd be something cool to try, but it didn‚Äôt come with the egg yolk dip, which made it feel incomplete. Honestly, the whole experience felt like if you didn‚Äôt already know what to order, too bad‚Äîthe server wasn‚Äôt going to guide you.

After the meal, I did some research and realized I missed out on a bunch of items I would‚Äôve liked to try. Overall, the experience felt overrated, and I wish I had spent that $400 somewhere else. Disappointing Food Quality at Niku X
I visited Niku X and have no complaints about the service. The staff were very friendly, cleaned our table promptly, and frequently checked if everything was okay. However, the food was a major letdown. It wasn‚Äôt terrible, but it was far from good. The meat was overly fatty (not same as wagyu that we had in Japan), and the crab was excessively salty, almost as if it was intentionally overseasoned to discourage eating too much.
Initially, I thought $149 was reasonable for high-quality meat, crab, and lobster, but we ended up with portions that felt worth only about $30. Even as someone who doesn‚Äôt eat large portions, I couldn‚Äôt enjoy more than a few bites. I‚Äôm writing this review to save others time and money. You‚Äôre better off dining somewhere else with better quality food and portions that are satisfying, especially if you‚Äôre not a big eater. For a luxury restaurant, it's not just about the food but the whole dining experience. Here are the details:
Reservations for the Chubby insiders (Gold
NFT), who has priority reservations privileges: me.
1 star At reservation via Discord community concierge, it didn't require me to select tomahawk dinner or buffet dinner. I thought it is a decision at dine-in time. OpenTables reservation does request/require the decision (kudos!) This resulted in not getting the meal I made the restaurant reservation for. Mission unaccomplished! Zero (0) stars
Made the reservation at 6:30pm but not at my requested time: 7:30pm. 1 star
Management review 2 stars
The manager came to explain that reservation is required to order the tomahawk meal and there must be an issue with the corporate priority reservation system. I commend the Manager's patience to explain that it takes 3 hours to prepare the tomahawk and so requires the reservation. I told him that I drove 500 miles to dine there and see if he can help find a solution. He was patient but can't offer any solutions. Sigh... He did ask if there is anything he can do to make my stay more pleasant, please let him know. Hmmm... although sincere, but no real solution and no hard offers. Hey, a $5 discount coupon or some concession of something can ease my displeasure of the establishment (whether it is corporate or the operator that made the mistake for my predicament of not getting the meal I intended to have). Another solution is to start cooking another tomahawk at 6:30pm for the 9:30 client and provide the spare for me.
They close at midnight. Hey, I'm not manager to offer solutions. I felt he could have done better.
Decor (decoration) is nice but the environment feels like a flea market... as an upscale restaurant with $100-$250 meal tickets, something can be done to make it more comfy.
More comments if inquired.

Feedback at Discord: zero stars
I thought that I would provide this feedback internally to the company via their chat community. "Aiyu Jelly" handle name which is a trusted friend of the company responded by implying that i didn't read the menu. The fine print is embedded in the menu of 8x11 with a small print. Check it out. I'll bet you can't find it.
Then, some of my comments similar to this here are censored (deleted) in the feedback section! I don't know if the same person or other company person did the censoring. Why ask for feedback when censoring? And I'm locked out for 24 hours in commenting. So, here I am.
As for the server Nate, excellent 5+ stars service. Patient in hearing my orders; gives great recommendations and offers different ways to enjoy my meal. Michelin Star service.
The company should give him bonuses!
Food & drinks: 3 stars summary
Since I didn't get my intended meal of sit down served meal of tomahawk plus seafood & appetizers. -2 stars

Fruity cocktail was offered & accepted. Excellent tastes with the lychee infused alcoholic drink.
(3.0 stars.)
Meat & seafood (3 stars)
A5 steaks... filet, rib eye, ny steak all excellent quality ... 4 stars rounded down to 3 stars. And I have to cook it myself on the grill. Grill fire is quite high and not adjustable, so it's hard to cook it correctly (-1 star). Nate (server) suggested that I let the kitchen cook it. It's better but still not the best. For the buffet review: the cooked seafood quality was 3 stars ... limited in variety and bland. Lobster tail was cold & I had to put in the grill to heat it up (2 stars). Perhaps some sauce can be provided besides hot butter? The sashimi of tuna, hamachi & salmon are pretty good. (3.5 stars).
Side dishes & appetizers & dessert & coffee shishito peppers very good with right sauce
4 stars
Seabass lettuce wrap... yummy but not can be tastier or wrapped better 3.5 stars
Oxtail pot stickers... meat inside is too dry.
Sauce was nice . 1 star
Matcha cheesecake 1 star the other "x" cheesecake 3 stars
Espresso $8 is too acidic... 1 star
Wagyu taco is tasty 3 stars
Shrimp uni taco 3 stars
Wagyu fried rice 3.5 stars Food: 3 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 2

For a luxury restaurant, it's not just about the food but the whole dining experience. Here are the details:
Reservations for the Chubby insiders (Gold
NFT), who has priority reservations privileges: me.
1 star At reservation via Discord community concierge, it didn't require me to select tomahawk dinner or buffet dinner. I thought it is a decision at dine-in time. OpenTables reservation does request/require the decision (kudos!) This resulted in not getting the meal I made the restaurant reservation for. Mission unaccomplished! Zero (0) stars
Made the reservation at 6:30pm but not at my requested time: 7:30pm. 1 star
Management review 2 stars
The manager came to explain that reservation is required to order the tomahawk meal and there must be an issue with the corporate priority reservation system. I commend the Manager's patience to explain that it takes 3 hours to prepare the tomahawk and so requires the reservation. I told him that I drove 500 miles to dine there and see if he can help find a solution. He was patient but can't offer any solutions. Sigh... He did ask if there is anything he can do to make my stay more pleasant, please let him know. Hmmm... although sincere, but no real solution and no hard offers. Hey, a $5 discount coupon or some concession of something can ease my displeasure of the establishment (whether it is corporate or the operator that made the mistake for my predicament of not getting the meal I intended to have). Another solution is to start cooking another tomahawk at 6:30pm for the 9:30 client and provide the spare for me.
They close at midnight. Hey, I'm not manager to offer solutions. I felt he could have done better.
Decor (decoration) is nice but the environment feels like a flea market... as an upscale restaurant with $100-$250 meal tickets, something can be done to make it more comfy.
More comments if inquired.

Feedback at Discord: zero stars
I thought that I would provide this feedback internally to the company via their chat community. "Aiyu Jelly" handle name which is a trusted friend of the company responded by implying that i didn't read the menu. The fine print is embedded in the menu of 8x11 with a small print. Check it out. I'll bet you can't find it.
Then, some of my comments similar to this here are censored (deleted) in the feedback section! I don't know if the same person or other company person did the censoring. Why ask for feedback when censoring? And I'm locked out for 24 hours in commenting. So, here I am.
As for the server Nate, excellent 5+ stars service. Patient in hearing my orders; gives great recommendations and offers different ways to enjoy my meal. Michelin Star service.
The company should give him bonuses!
Food & drinks: 3 stars summary
Since I didn't get my intended meal of sit down served meal of tomahawk plus seafood & appetizers. -2 stars

Fruity cocktail was offered & accepted. Excellent tastes with the lychee infused alcoholic drink.
(3.0 stars.)
Meat & seafood (3 stars)
A5 steaks... filet, rib eye, ny steak all excellent quality ... 4 stars rounded down to 3 stars. And I have to cook it myself on the grill. Grill fire is quite high and not adjustable, so it's hard to cook it correctly (-1 star). Nate (server) suggested that I let the kitchen cook it. It's better but still not the best. For the buffet review: the cooked seafood quality was 3 stars ... limited in variety and bland. Lobster tail was cold & I had to put in the grill to heat it up (2 stars). Perhaps some sauce can be provided besides hot butter? The sashimi of tuna, hamachi & salmon are pretty good. (3.5 stars).
Side dishes & appetizers & dessert & coffee shishito peppers very good with right sauce
4 stars
Seabass lettuce wrap... yummy but not can be tastier or wrapped better 3.5 stars
Oxtail pot stickers... meat inside is too dry.
Sauce was nice . 1 star
Matcha cheesecake 1 star the other "x" cheesecake 3 stars
Espresso $8 is too acidic... 1 star
Wagyu taco is tasty 3 stars
Shrimp uni taco 3 stars
Wagyu fried rice 3.5 stars Food: 3 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 2

This was not the Premium Option, but we were sat late at 10 pm and we were told the chef‚Äôs order  from the kitchen would be closed in 15 minutes (90 minutes before closing time); therefore that destroyed the whole dinner.

This restaurant would be out of business if it was in NYC.

This is a restaurant full of rules and quirks. You submit to the rules right on the reservation website, where you try to choose the menu you want to eat from, but the information is obscure and difficult to understand. Then, at the time of the meal, they try to put you on a more expensive menu, saying that it's for you... Enjoying the cheaper menu at $109.00 will require an extra hour's wait, and most customers are willing to pay the $158.00 menu, which is nothing special, just with fewer annoying rules for ordering dishes.
If you intend to eat wagyu beef, you can accept the higher price, but if you want seafood like King Crab and lobster, I don't recommend this place. They removed scallops and oysters from the menu, so it's not worth submitting to so many rules like time limits and restricted dishes, etc.
The King Crab is served cold, which makes it quite tasteless, while the Snow Crab is served hot and was very tasty.
It's nothing more than a restaurant with unfavorable cost-benefit!
Look for another place in Los Angeles that's like seafood, and you'll be much better served. Food: 2 Service: 2 Atmosphere: 2

Wow what a SHAM! In all the YouTube videos reviewing Niku x show giant king crab legs as long as your forearm,  but in reality they averaged 7 to 8 in. Moreover the circumference was maybe 3 in. The spiny points made it almost impossible to extract the meat! Scissors were so big and dull you couldn't cut them! With a 2 hr limit you can't ingest enough flesh too feel satisfied; punctured my fingers and lips! All you can eat lobster is now by ordering one to two at a time; time consuming. Couldn't get meat out of shell; it broke apart in fibers! They advertised oysters and scallops; ok right!
They've been removed from menu!
Crustaceans were salty and king crab dry.
$5 for 4 or 5 oz bottle of diet coke omg.
Server was nice ambiance nice; but dropped
$295 w/ parking and tip;  only thing good was beef; sea bass under cooked no smoky flavor. Bet you they'll never get me again shame on you niku x sham!

For my birthday, i took my family of 6  to Niku-x.for bbq buffet. We chose the $139 premium buffet.  Be aware that many dishes are not offered from the Youtube reviews you might have viewed. No special sashimi dish, sushi, sukiyaki, etc. The lobster tail  was small (more like crawfish)  and Costco had bigger, tastier king crab legs. The salad selection is very  limited and fast food quality. Crazy to spend ~ $1200 for six people for mediocre food and diner experience. Very disappointed with the overall selection and quality. Not recommended. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 3 Atmosphere: 2

This restaurant was a major disappointment. I cannot believe that my parents and I spent $500 only to receive such poor service. On multiple occasions, I had to get up from the table because our server was nowhere to be found. We repeatedly asked for the table to be cleared, yet it remained cluttered throughout the meal. To make matters worse, the desserts were brought out while the table was still in the same state, as shown in the attached photo‚Äîfurther reflecting the lack of attention to service.

I chose the highest-tier buffet option, which is advertised as including premium Japanese beef cuts. However, the seafood selection was extremely underwhelming. The so-called King Crab was completely tasteless and appeared to have been frozen for a long time. As shown in the photos, the crab legs were unusually thin and lacked any substantial meat, making it clear that they had been stored frozen for an extended period. The same applies to the entire seafood bar.

Regarding the Japanese beef cuts, I have been to Japan over ten times and dined at no fewer than six reputable steak houses. Based on my experience, the beef served here was clearly frozen, and its quality was mediocre at best. While the restaurant claims to offer A5-grade meat, I find that highly unlikely. I have had A5 beef on numerous occasions, and while these cuts may indeed be Japanese, they do not meet the standards of true A5 quality.

The service was equally disappointing. Beyond the lack of attentiveness, the dessert‚Äîa simple H√§agen-Dazs ice cream‚Äîwas served in its original packaging with plastic spoons, showing a complete disregard for presentation. This level of service and quality might be acceptable at a $30-per-person establishment, but certainly not at a restaurant charging over $150 per person.

I hope this review helps others make an informed decision and avoid an experience that falls far short of expectations. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1
