We visited Niku x in between Christmas and New Year's. Perfect timing. Went right when they opened. Made a reservation about a month in advance but at that time you didn't need one. The atmosphere was really good but not what I expected for the price.

The buffet food was plentiful and had great flavors. Lots of crab legs, limited Sushi but lots of things you could order from a menu that were included in your meal price.

The service was fantastic. Our server was wonderful. She gave us lots of tips on what to order from the menu and how to order from the menu. If you are celebrating a birthday, great place to go and always ask for a slushie at the end. That was the best surprise of the evening.

The slices of wagyu beef are one to two bites. You can get as much wagyu beef as you like. However, they do have a 30% waste fee if they see that you are taking more food than you can eat.

It was a nice experience and gift for my family for Christmas. Special occasions I would go again. Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

I found out about this spot through a YouTube video & it looked like a great restaurant.  Just be aware to make a reservation you have to put down a deposit, which I did(cost depending on your party size).  There are different types of tables too(a la carte, tasting & others) & I chose the Yakiniku tasting.

First off it‚Äôs an expensive spot, if you just want to get full on meat, you can go to my favorite spot, Quarters KBBQ in Koreatown. This spot is more of an elaborate presentation & elevated dining experience. The decor and interior overall was solid & I wish I could of toured the whole location.

The tasting was absolutely phenomenal, but If I had to do it all over again, I think I would have went for the Tomahawk upgrade. I sat in an area without a view, which would have been something I‚Äôd recommend in getting to fully enjoy the experience. Also I forgot to get a good glass of red wine to pair with the offerings. The bar area was solid & I wonder if you can just walk in for just the bar area.

Each dish was carefully crafted and made to joyfully amuse your tastebuds. The meats were so fresh, seasoned perfectly & probably the best I‚Äôve ever had, but at a cost. There is so much more to explore on their menu, like their Wagyu bone Marrow, other entrees & desserts.

I‚Äôd definitely come back again to try their tomahawk offering.  Once I try their best option & get a better view of the spot, than I can justify a full 5 stars(will take a while because I got to recoup some funds lol).  The customer service though is without a doubt excellent and deserving of a 5 because they cater to a lot of the needs you had as a customer.

Just be aware it‚Äôs valet mainly or discounted parking but not free.  I walked to this spot to avoid the parking hoopla. Enjoy the spot & yolo responsibly!

***updated***
Recently did the Wagyu Tomahawk Tasting and it was phenomenal, just check out the pictures and videos. Originally I rated this spot four stars for their sushi mainly but after this tomahawk experience, it‚Äôs now a full 5 stars.

***Update***
I tried their $150 all you can eat wagyu buffet with seafood and lobster with my parents. It was phenomenal and thanks to Kelly our server for an excellent experience.

My warning to you is eat to be satisfied and don‚Äôt go overboard otherwise they will charge you for wasting food. Luckily my parents and I ate it all but I should have stopped a few plates ago. The Wagyu quality was top notch and the menu items were excellent.

For the price it‚Äôs worth it and I would say pace yourself. Had a reservation for 2 for Niku X on Friday night at 9:30 PM. Niku X is located in the Wilshire-Grand Building on the 2nd floor on the opposite side of the Intercontinenal Hotel. Found street parking on Figueroa & 6th. We took the escalators up and were about 20 minutes early, we were greeted by the hostess and led to the waiting area and given a drinks menu. Originally our reservation was for the $99 option but we decided to do the $139 instead (unfortunately we did not get to do the tomahawk that is part of the $139 option as we needed to preorder by 1:30 PM). We waited about 5 minutes and were led to our giant table with a grill in the center. Mikey introduced himself to us as our server and he was cool, friendly and very attentive along with the other staff.

To start off there is the self-serve buffet style salad bar (NIKU salad, mushrooms & zucchini for grilling, seafood salad, kimchi, fruit), then the crudo bar (wagyu tartare, bluefin tuna toro w/ scallion, salmon, A5 wagyu tartare, amberjack, halibut, scallop, ceviche), then the hot foods (white rice topped with furikake, wagyu curry, wagyu mapo tofu, fried veggies, shrimp tempura and then the meat locker (Japanese A5 chef's choice steak, Japanese A5 top sirloin, American Wagyu Ribeye, American Wagyu Striploin, American Wagyu Tenderloin) and then the chilled seafood (oysters, scallops, lobster tail, snow crab legs & king crab legs) and the condiments (lemon, cajun butter, pink peppercorn mignonette & yuzu cocktail sauce) and lastly a small dessert section.

There were items on the menu that you had to order through your server. We tried the potato pave, oxtail potstickers, A5 wagyu sando, miso Chilean sea bass, wagyu tallow shishito peppers, wagyu sukiyaki, and lamb lollipop. Because of the $139 option we were each allowed to order 1 item from the Chef's Special Seafood so we chose the ultimate sashimi platter (assorted sashimi, uni, foie gras, caviar) and sushi platter which was incredible. The quality of fish was very fresh, each piece of sushi was dabbed with a little sauce/tare and the slightly acidic vinegar rice was perfect and really opened up the appetite.

The meat what can I say? Every single piece melted in the mouth, after a slight sear on both sides of the beef and got great maillard reaction. You can season your meat with the condiments at the table  (salt, pepper, chili powder, wasabi salt, house blend, truffle salt). Our favorites were definitely the Japanese cuts, they were VERY rich and a little goes a long way but it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout being able to enjoy small dishes of quality seafood from the crudo bar or some salad  in between the rich meat and most definitely the seafood... not many places offer king crab legs so this is legit, crab crackers and crab shears provided as well, the crab meat were both so naturally sweet with a bit of brininess from the salt water, id say the crab legs alone make it worth it, just go to Costco and take a look at the cooked red king crab legs. I didn't try any of the desserts or hot food items except for the wagyu fried rice and shrimp tempura but I'll definitely be back to enjoy the full experience, hopefully with an earlier reservation time.

Also, this is a restaurant part of the Chubby Group (Chubby Cattle, Chubby Curry, Wagyu House, Yumiyaki, Mikiya, Chubby Skewers) so make sure you get the app and points! We visited Niku X for their new lobster and wagyu seafood buffet yesterday, and it was fantastic! Even before the doors opened, there was already a line, which shows how popular it is.

Unless you‚Äôre vegetarian, you will love your experience at Niku X. They have beautiful aesthetics and a high attention to detail. The interior architecture is modern and elegant, while the decorations and food presentation compliment these themes. The staff are very kind, though one of them acted a bit informal. Our server was very friendly, which I love in a course meal, being able to chat with them during the experience. The only downside of the space is that the restaurant was playing upbeat music which was loud. It was a bit bothersome and was hard to hear the servers explaining each course.
Onto the food, I highly recommend the course meals because these are experiences designed from beginning to last and they give you a full experience. I chose the lower priced menu because the starters felt more appealing, and they definitely hit the spot. All the dishes throughout the night are very rich, overflowing with umami flavors from ingredients like truffle, Wagyu, and egg yolk. At the same time, the chefs at Niku X know to pair these fatty beef cuts with acidic garnishes like lemon and ume, which helps balance out the intensity. I can nitpick a few things, but that is after understanding that the whole meal was amazing. With the tenderloin, they present it on a small, soft slice of bread and this portion was hard to eat without it all falling apart. The sukiyaki had a whole shiso leaf with it to eat, and that was overbearing over the rest of the ingredients.
If you are looking for a premium dinner experience, definitely look to Niku X to be pampered with an incredibly enjoyable night. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Recommended dishes

I recently had the absolute pleasure of dining at NIKU X in downtown LA, and I cannot emphasize enough just how incredible the experience was. From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were welcomed by a warm and luxurious atmosphere that promised a truly high-end dining experience.

One of the most impressive aspects of NIKU X is their extraordinary use of ingredients. Their signature dish, which combines the finest wayu beef with an innovative blend of caviar, is nothing short of a culinary masterpiece. The fusion of flavors and textures was a delightful surprise that left our taste buds dancing with excitement.

Now, let me tell you about our server, Robert. His exceptional service was the cherry on top of an already perfect evening. Robert's professionalism and expertise were evident from the moment he introduced himself to us. He guided us through each course with meticulous explanations and cooking demonstrations that showcased his extensive knowledge and passion for the cuisine. It was an interactive and educational experience that made the meal even more enjoyable.

Robert's attentive and personable demeanor made us feel like VIP guests. He managed to strike the perfect balance between being available for our needs and giving us space to enjoy our meal. We truly appreciated his genuine enthusiasm and warmth, which only added to the overall charm of NIKU X.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly give NIKU X and our server Robert a well-deserved five-star rating. Their unparalleled culinary creations, coupled with Robert's exceptional service, made for a dining experience that will forever be etched in our memories. If you're looking for a high-end dining experience that will transport your senses to new heights, look no further than NIKU X in downtown LA. We can't wait to return! This was my first time ever eating at a Michelin-rated restaurant! My boyfriend and I had an amazing experience! We made a reservation a week in advance and were seated promptly by the window with a great view.

We ordered only from the A La Carte menu because we wanted to have more control over our dining experience.

Started off with the Oxtail & Wagyu Potstickers and the Wagyu Tartare. The potstickers were tasty and had a lot of savory/umami/citrus notes. The tartare was a completely new experience for both of us as we'd never eaten raw beef before. It was seasoned really well and the texture wasn't off putting. Quail egg was a great touch.

Next we were served our choices of meat: Masami Outside Skirt Wagyu, Miyazaki Tri Tip, and Stone Axe Short Rib. The wagyu was melt-in-your-mouth delicious and a favorite for both of us. The other two cuts were slightly more tough to chew, but sooo flavorful and buttery. The server gave us pairing recommendations for the condiments & meat.

The star of the show was truly the Dry Aged Masami Strip Loin. We got an 8 oz. portion instead of 6 oz. due to our order being put in incorrectly. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare!

Finally ended our dinner with the Wagyu Fried Rice. This was tasty and had flavor components that a traditional fried rice wouldn't have. Lots of citrus notes and the egg presentation was beautiful. The wagyu bits were cut up so tiny though, it made me forget there was wagyu in the dish at all.

Lastly, they treated us to two complimentary desserts! We got the matcha pillow and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e. The matcha pillow is just matcha ice cream, but I could tell the matcha quality was very good. The cr√®me br√ªl√©e wasn't anything special but it was good!

I'm subtracting 1-star because I do think they're still getting into the swing of things, as they haven't officially had a grand opening yet. For first timers, I think there could have been a bit more assistance with explaining the menu beforehand - we had to ask the waiter for recommendations! The format of the meat grilling felt a little awkward at times because the server was just standing there watching us eat. And as I mentioned earlier, there was a misunderstanding with the order, so the strip loin and fried rice weren't put in until we asked about it later. We fortunately didn't have to pay for parking because we didn't drive, but I do think the $16.50 fee for parking valet is a bit ridiculous for how much you're paying to eat. Overall though this made for a perfect date night and our waiter Meng was fantastic! I really appreciated when he brought out the strip loin and he told us to start video recording because the steak reveal was so grand! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+

NIKU X is a must try! We first heard about NIKU X on TikTok and realized that we've been to one of their sister companies, Chubby Cattle in Las Vegas. If you haven't been, it is also a must try when you're in sin city!

Located on the 2nd floor of the Intercontinental hotel. You won't get lost, there's a bunch of signs telling you where to go via escalator or elevator.

We got the Yakiniku Tasting Menu which includes appetizers, yakiniku, and dessert. Every dish was very decadent and umami from start to finish -- the uni, caviar and wagyu tartare dish to the different types of wagyu from the US, Australia, and Japan. You'll leave wanting more of the toriyama sandwich with foie gras and milk bread.

Besides the food, the vibe and the service by Mama J was phenomenal - she was funny and also attentive to make our experience one-of-a-kind. Thanks again for the lovely service and delicious food. We will be back soon to try out the Tomahawk Tasting Menu! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Located on the 2nd floor at the Intercontinental Hotel. You have the option to valet or self-park. NIKU X will validate your parking at a discounted rate.

Negative.Context:
Disappointing Food Quality at Niku X
I visited Niku X and have no complaints about the service. The staff were very friendly, cleaned our table promptly, and frequently checked if everything was okay. However, the food was a major letdown. It wasn‚Äôt terrible, but it was far from good. The meat was overly fatty (not same as wagyu that we had in Japan), and the crab was excessively salty, almost as if it was intentionally overseasoned to discourage eating too much.
Initially, I thought $149 was reasonable for high-quality meat, crab, and lobster, but we ended up with portions that felt worth only about $30. Even as someone who doesn‚Äôt eat large portions, I couldn‚Äôt enjoy more than a few bites. I‚Äôm writing this review to save others time and money. You‚Äôre better off dining somewhere else with better quality food and portions that are satisfying, especially if you‚Äôre not a big eater. For a luxury restaurant, it's not just about the food but the whole dining experience. Here are the details:
Reservations for the Chubby insiders (Gold
NFT), who has priority reservations privileges: me.
1 star At reservation via Discord community concierge, it didn't require me to select tomahawk dinner or buffet dinner. I thought it is a decision at dine-in time. OpenTables reservation does request/require the decision (kudos!) This resulted in not getting the meal I made the restaurant reservation for. Mission unaccomplished! Zero (0) stars
Made the reservation at 6:30pm but not at my requested time: 7:30pm. 1 star
Management review 2 stars
The manager came to explain that reservation is required to order the tomahawk meal and there must be an issue with the corporate priority reservation system. I commend the Manager's patience to explain that it takes 3 hours to prepare the tomahawk and so requires the reservation. I told him that I drove 500 miles to dine there and see if he can help find a solution. He was patient but can't offer any solutions. Sigh... He did ask if there is anything he can do to make my stay more pleasant, please let him know. Hmmm... although sincere, but no real solution and no hard offers. Hey, a $5 discount coupon or some concession of something can ease my displeasure of the establishment (whether it is corporate or the operator that made the mistake for my predicament of not getting the meal I intended to have). Another solution is to start cooking another tomahawk at 6:30pm for the 9:30 client and provide the spare for me.
They close at midnight. Hey, I'm not manager to offer solutions. I felt he could have done better.
Decor (decoration) is nice but the environment feels like a flea market... as an upscale restaurant with $100-$250 meal tickets, something can be done to make it more comfy.
More comments if inquired.

Feedback at Discord: zero stars
I thought that I would provide this feedback internally to the company via their chat community. "Aiyu Jelly" handle name which is a trusted friend of the company responded by implying that i didn't read the menu. The fine print is embedded in the menu of 8x11 with a small print. Check it out. I'll bet you can't find it.
Then, some of my comments similar to this here are censored (deleted) in the feedback section! I don't know if the same person or other company person did the censoring. Why ask for feedback when censoring? And I'm locked out for 24 hours in commenting. So, here I am.
As for the server Nate, excellent 5+ stars service. Patient in hearing my orders; gives great recommendations and offers different ways to enjoy my meal. Michelin Star service.
The company should give him bonuses!
Food & drinks: 3 stars summary
Since I didn't get my intended meal of sit down served meal of tomahawk plus seafood & appetizers. -2 stars

Fruity cocktail was offered & accepted. Excellent tastes with the lychee infused alcoholic drink.
(3.0 stars.)
Meat & seafood (3 stars)
A5 steaks... filet, rib eye, ny steak all excellent quality ... 4 stars rounded down to 3 stars. And I have to cook it myself on the grill. Grill fire is quite high and not adjustable, so it's hard to cook it correctly (-1 star). Nate (server) suggested that I let the kitchen cook it. It's better but still not the best. For the buffet review: the cooked seafood quality was 3 stars ... limited in variety and bland. Lobster tail was cold & I had to put in the grill to heat it up (2 stars). Perhaps some sauce can be provided besides hot butter? The sashimi of tuna, hamachi & salmon are pretty good. (3.5 stars).
Side dishes & appetizers & dessert & coffee shishito peppers very good with right sauce
4 stars
Seabass lettuce wrap... yummy but not can be tastier or wrapped better 3.5 stars
Oxtail pot stickers... meat inside is too dry.
Sauce was nice . 1 star
Matcha cheesecake 1 star the other "x" cheesecake 3 stars
Espresso $8 is too acidic... 1 star
Wagyu taco is tasty 3 stars
Shrimp uni taco 3 stars

I don't understand the high reviews.  I'm literally at the restaurant writing this review.  This place sucks.  Also, we had a reservation but still waited about 30 minutes. The sushi and fish did not taste fresh.  The buffet sashimi was warm.  You have to hunt down a cup for soy sauce.  I used the huge foil cup for sauce, that meant to used for hot butter for the crab legs.

We paid for the $139 experience.  We asked for sodas and they only offered sprite and Diet Coke bc they were out of other sodas.  You think for $100 a person there will be soda.  Btw the soda is in a glass bottle at almost $9.00 a bottle.

The seabass came out cold.  The sushi was warm.  The taste was off.   Most of the buffet was not tasty.  The crab legs and shrimp was the only good seafood at the buffet.

We've gone to multiple Chubby Cattles.  Rowland Heights and Little Tokyo Chubby Cattle are in a different league compared to this place.  The sushi is so much better and the sides are better at the other Chubby Cattle restaurants.

We spoke to the manager and he only discounted our Sprites!!!!!

Go to other Chubby Group restaurants.  I was looking forward to this place.  Save your money.  I thought NikuX would be amazing since it‚Äôs so much more expensive.

Btw Shiki Buffet in Temple City tasted better than this place and it's only $40.  I never get warm sushi from that buffet.

Also, you don't get a discount here if you have the membership from Chubby Cattle.  The manager told me at least get points after you pay.  Points are nice but rather have the $300 I spent at NikuX returned.

When I‚Äôve gone to Chubby Cattle in Rowland Heights we were sat in a corner table on a busy day.  The manager there felt so bad about us sitting at the worst table, he gave us one free membership.  And we didn‚Äôt even complain about the seating lol.  This place is like aww too bad you spent $300, hopefully we do a better job when you come back.  Why would we come back??? Feeling + sweet and salty. There is no sign at the entrance on the first floor, so you have to ask the staff. Do not take the hotel elevator. Parking is only valet, and if you get validation, it costs $16.50 for 2 hours and 30 minutes. Wagyu BBQ is better than seafood. King crab. Lobster, sashimi. $109 (Friday, Saturday, Sunday). Make a reservation 2 months in advance. If you don't want to wait, you can eat at the bar for $139. For $109, I grill the meat. For $139, the staff grills it and brings it to you. Japanese A5 top sirloin flower. chelf choice A5. It's delicious, but it's too oily to eat a lot, so it's a shame. I thought From Chef would be special, so I ordered a few, but except for the lobster tail, there's nothing that's "wow~ delicious", and I'm so full that it's hard to eat anything else, so I don't recommend it. I think it felt even more greasy because there were no vegetables or refreshing flavors to go with the grill. I saw oysters and scrubs on YouTube, but they weren't there the day I went. The lobster was hard to eat because the shell didn't separate because they cooked it somehow. The king crab wasn't high quality, but it was all small and low quality and not very edible, so it was a bit disappointing. You have to call 24 hours in advance for dry-aged meat. The atmosphere is good, but the servers are busy and they bring it a bit late when you order. It's a bit disappointing because there's nothing worth eating for the price. I don't think I'll come back again because the price is too high. Food: 3 Service: 3 Atmosphere: 5

**Disappointing Experience at Niku X**

We had high hopes for our visit to Niku X, but unfortunately, the experience fell far short of expectations. As a group of eight, we booked the full-service option and arrived at 8:30 PM for our 8:45 reservation. Despite arriving early, we weren‚Äôt seated until 9 PM, which was frustrating and set the tone for the evening.

Once seated, things only got worse. The grill at our table was broken, and we were told there was no other table available to accommodate us. Since we paid for the full-service option, we weren‚Äôt even allowed to grill our own meat, which we would have preferred given the circumstances.

The service was painfully slow. It took over an hour for the first round of our limited 15 items to arrive, leaving us with little time to enjoy the meal within the 2-hour limit. The presentation of the meat was subpar‚Äîcuts were not well-prepared or what you'd expect from a high-end restaurant.

The most disappointing part was the quality of the food. The A5 wagyu beef from our second order was chewy and lacked the signature tenderness you‚Äôd expect from wagyu. It was so poor that we questioned whether it was even wagyu at all.

While some staff members were polite, the overall experience was not worth the $1,500 we paid. Waiting for food, dealing with a broken grill, and being unable to enjoy the meal as promised made for a truly disappointing evening. We won‚Äôt be returning and can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 2 Service: 2 Atmosphere: 3

Food 0/10
From chef: they delivered really slowly and the most items were really dry and bland. (But katsu sando and yaki udon were too salty lol)
Buffet station : really seriously dirty, and I felt no one really not cared the cleanliness. I lost my appetite when I saw the buffet station. For the public health, please pay more attention to maintain the cleanliness! Especially this restaurant mainly carry seafood, but I felt dangerous when I imagine to have this food from the station. (This seafood area has stinky smells, nasty)
The wagyu was not that crazy bad, but never worth with this price.

Just highly recommend to all,
If you feel $99+tax and tip as like feel $1.
Please don't take a risk of your health with paying.

Service 5/10
The receptionists were really rude and unprofessional. The table was not ready yet, but they said wait in front of table till they finish to clean.
But the server was ok.

Ambiance 7/10
The ambiance was pretty.!
And the table was good for the grill.
But the light was too dart so I can't see the meat on the grill.

Overall
I am never back to here again.!

Niku restaurant is a bit of a letdown. The vibe is nice with modern decor, but it‚Äôs way too dim for my taste. Our server, Mike, was friendly and helpful. However, the buffet bar was way too dark, especially the sushi section. The lobster was tiny, like the ones you'd find at a Chinese buffet, and it was dry. The King crab was way too salty, had to drink water just to get it down. The made-to-order dishes were hit or miss. The meat was decent, but I‚Äôm not into wagyu. I prefer american ribeye which was good. Dessert options were limited, and honestly, the taste wasn‚Äôt great. I‚Äôd rather go to Chubby Cattle and pay half the price for a better experience. Went to Niku X for my fianc√©e‚Äôs birthday and opted for the full-service meal to make it memorable. When we arrived, they acknowledged her birthday, but that was the last time it was mentioned, which was disappointing. We‚Äôd also reserved a tomahawk steak and confirmed it with the waiter at the start of the meal, but it was somehow forgotten about by their team. We only realized this toward the end of our meal, and it took 30 more minutes just to come out, tried enjoying it but that made us late for valet and added to our costs.

The service overall felt off. Our waiter checked on us much less while being noticeably more attentive to other tables. For the price and the occasion, I expected a much higher level of service and attention to detail.
Definitely left feeling disappointed and let down. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 2 Atmosphere: 4

If I can rate this place as 0/5 I would. I was utterly appalled and frankly disappointed in this establishment. If you want cheaper AYCE wagyu/sushi, I think driving to one of their sister restaurants is more cost efficient (such as Yumiyaki, Mikiya, or even Chubby Cattle). Those other restaurants are cheaper and judging by how they serve sushi and Japanese Wagyu also, it's better to get those dishes there than pay a butt load for this place.

We got the upgraded option of $139, and opted out to order any large steaks that you pre- order (ex. tomahawks range from 35-40 oz, and some other options that you can select of your choosing.

Service: Extremely horrendous. I had runners/staff members not even know the simple aspect of having certain condiments at their restaurant. One runner said they didn't have tabasco, but had chili oil; only for a FOH manager to come by and say they have no tabasco and chili oil. Our server kept getting our orders wrong which caused a delay in our meat being served because we were sat at a non-grill table. Our server admitted to getting the orders wrong completely. Wait was over 15-20 minutes long in between waiting for the next round. Runners/servers also kept serving dishes on the side of the table even if there was room in the middle of the table. Dishes were not cleaned up. I had almost 4 plates stacked just from appetizers because I was starving between rounds of meat never coming essentially.

Ambiance: The restaurant is nice, but with the amount of complaining tables surrounding our area, I definitely didn't think that I was at a high end semi fancy restaurant at all. Interior is dark and nice, but the buffet line could use some work as it is a narrow walkway and some patrons decide to stand and block the way as well.

Food: Subpar at best. If I wanted to get expensive cut meat and be paying for 139 for it, I should be getting top quality. It was lukewarm at minimum every time we received the meat. It wasn't cooked to our medium rare liking, and some of the meats weren't the ones we ordered since our server got out order wrong multiple times.

Manager Education: Its pretty comical when even the managers of this establishment aren't well trained, couldn't answer simple questions of why the wait was taking so long, why the service was horrible, and why the raw seafood bar was completely barren for a great portion of the time. When we asked these questions, they completely invalidated our party and didn't try to resolve the solution or provide alternatives in any way possible. Pretty disappointing for a restaurant group that I've had pretty adequate experiences at their other sister restaurants.

Overall, I am not stepping into this establishment again. This wasn't even half of the entire experience. I saw an influencer table get up and not touch their food or pay at all, and then another couple order the tomahawk and have a few bites and left, and then the table that got seated after they left also got up and complained why the food was delayed and the service was pretty unbearable. I advise eating at their sister restaurants for much cheaper like chubby cattle, yumiyaki, or even mikiya. At least you'll pay for the service you're getting and the quality of food. One of the worst experiences ever and to top it off, I sent an email to their feedback group and they promised they would get back in 48 hours, and they never got back to me :(. Save your money, and your wrinkles on this place. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

The food was terrible, and each dish took at least 15 minutes to prepare. At 139 yuan, this buffet is absolutely not worth the price. The service was also awful. They gave us a tiny table, and after we finished eating, no one came to clear our plates; we had to call them multiple times before they came. If you want to order drinks, remember, they are extra, and the staff won't tell you! The only difference between the 99 and 139 yuan buffets is that you can only order one of four dishes per person, and each serving only contains two pieces of food. Almost all the seafood was very stale; the only decent thing was the cake. We had to find a server three times and waited over ten minutes to pay the bill. A truly awful experience! We originally had a 7:15 reservation on Friday July 12 and once we checked in, we were told that there were a few tables ahead of us and we could wait in the waiting area/lobby. We assumed it would be a 10-15 minute wait but 30 minutes had already passed before any type of update. We spoke to one of the front managers and he had apologized for the wait but did not have an estimated time for the next available table. He offered us the regular menu to order some appetizers while we were still waiting in the lobby, so we had placed an order for 2 Japanese Albacore with Crispy Onion handrolls to tide over our appetite. We were waiting roughly for 10-15 minutes for our order, but thankfully we were called for an open table.

We were finally seated at 8:15pm and immediately placed our food order for the DineLA menu. We received our first order of the crudo along with our order of the 2 albacore handrolls at 8:22pm. We quickly devoured those 2 items after waiting an hour to be seated. We were waiting on our next course but we did not receive it until 8:49pm. We received our Dashi Yukke Soup at a warm but not hot temperature and 27 minutes after our first course.

At this point, we were extremely hungry and disappointed in the level of execution and service at the restaurant. To wait nearly 30 minutes in between each course was completely absurd. If we continued with the same pace, our dinner would last 2 hours and we would end our dinner at 10pm. We spoke with the manager and he apologized for the wait and offered to ask the chef if they could expedite the rest of our menu. We then got the rest of the menu (Chimichurri Bone Marrow and A5 Wagyu Yakiniku) 10 minutes later. We also received the Fried Brussel Sprouts on the house.

To conclude dinner, they also sent over 2 desserts. We appreciated that they were able to comp the handrolls, brussel sprouts, and desserts for all the inconvenience. Once we received the check, the manager came over again to apologize for the wait and offered us a 15% service discount. We left the restaurant after paying.

I started feeling some stomach pains once we left the restaurant. I confided with my friend who I had ate with and she had also had slight stomach pains. On my drive home, I started to feel nauseous and knew it was definitely from something I had eaten. My friend later confided in me that she started feeling the same way around 4am. We felt horrible and found out that we both got food poisoning. We both concluded that it must have been something we had both eaten at the restaurant since we both had similar symptoms. We are both extremely disappointed in the whole experience given that Niku X holds such a high standard for food and experience. Went here last night for my birthday dinner. Dinner came out to $650 for the two of us and at that price point, service should be top tier. It wasn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm surprised Chef Shin Thompson held a previous Michelin Star & overlooked the service. I never write reviews but last night‚Äôs service really pains me.

Service: Generous 1/5

1. Our menus when we sat down were bent and dirty (they‚Äôre printed on cardstock I‚Äôve bought at Michael‚Äôs). The courses also don‚Äôt follow the order of what comes out which was confusing
2. They don‚Äôt have purse or coat hooks so i was already like huh?? My purse fell on the floor & our jackets fell like 3x
3. Food Pacing- they dropped 4 dishes at once so by the time it was time for our soup, it was barely luke warm. Also, why don‚Äôt they have soup spoons? It was SO HARD to drink the soup. Bevel was so wide you couldn‚Äôt sip from the bowl.
4. They never changed our utensils. I had to ask constantly & they often left me without a knife ‚Ä¶ at a yakiniku restaurant. Also, I‚Äôm not going to slice into a beautiful cut of beef with a knife covered in fish juices or blueberry jam?
5. They put the scallop onto a plate with trash on it hahahah (leftover lemon from the dish prior)
6. When our server opened the box for the beef she walked away without even explaining what was what. I had to ask someone else walking by. This blew my mind & I have video of it. I spent majority of my dinner listening to the server at the table next to us. He did a much better job. Overheard him saying the $10 upcharge for the A5 ribeye would be a hotpot and I was like ‚Ä¶ huh, how was that never mentioned to us?
7. They didn‚Äôt even refill my water. I pushed my glass out as far as possible & couldn‚Äôt refill my own water unless I got up from my seat. Lastly, at the end of dinner they ignored my empty glass and grabbed the check right next to it. I was fuming. REFILL WATER. PLEASE. We paid $9 and we weren‚Äôt offered ‚Äúhouse‚Äù aka tap.

Food reviews:

Seafood: 2/5
Half the tasting menu was seafood (this surprised me). Majority of the seafood didn‚Äôt taste very clean, maybe I‚Äôm too spoiled having gone to places like n/naka. The scallop with uni butter would be a 5/5- that item saved the night.

Meats: 4/5
Maybe closer to a 3.5? We‚Äôll round up because the sauces were amazing. Good meats should be able to stand alone though- I‚Äôm not sure these would have. Most of the pieces were melty but still very chewy (cartilage/muscle). I wish we‚Äôd gone to a butcher and picked up an A5 Ribeye to make at home.

At least they brought out a happy birthday sign on my dessert. Don‚Äôt be like me and fall for the IG ads ‚Ä¶ Props to their marketing team. All and all, my friends and I had a a decent experience here.  Our waiter was wonderful, and the atmosphere was nice.  The food was okay. Some items were really good and others were just fine. Had high hopes. Atmosphere was great. Good was good but a few exceptions. We ordered a lemon drop. The drink came out looking pink and tasting like grapefruit. I asked,  is this a lemon drop? In addition, several orders that we ordered never came thru. Therfore service wasn't that great. The wives planned birthday dinner for a total of 3 very hungry dads.  We went with the Tomahawk menu.

A few things in random order:

1.) Location is great and so is the decor.
2.) We were seated promptly (a Thursday).  Party of 6 but they don't really have any rectangular tables so we sat in 1 square and 1 circular table so we could all fit.  That was odd and annoying.
3.)  Service is slow.   The place was not busy but the server would disappear for awhile.  I know it's a buffet but restaurants make $$ on drinks moreso than anything else.
4.) The drinks were....meh.   I was looking for a fancy old fashion or mule.  Instead the drink menu had 6 or 7 l drinks and it seemed all pre-made and some slushy style with alcohol.  (Felt cheap) Not a fancy menu at all for the top dollar being spent.  The wine was good but came in a bottle (lol)
5.) Seafood options - Lobster, Tiger/large shrimp, sushi.  These options were good - however - I would go elsewhere and eat that as a separate meal.
6.) The Tomahawk was ok.   We ordered 1 per couple.  It was too much because that should've been a separate meal as well.  Instead of eating buffet/unlimited seafood and a big tomahawk.   It would've been better to eat twice there at a more modest price.  (That was our bad)
7.) The Tomahawk "show" to wow us.  Meh... maybe because I got older and it was a repeat of a past experience.  We had 3 Tomahawks and got 1 show.   We had to share the first Tomahawk because they didn't bring us the other 2 until 30 mins later.   Again restaurant was not busy at all.
8.) The bill.  The bill came and certain items that were comped because of the birthday were not.  They were charged. Also, when they fixed it they taxed us on the FULL amount vs the subtotal.  Their excuse was that the item was "prepared" so it's still taxable.  Lastly on the bill.  The tip was automatically included on again the full amount including the items comped.   So where they comped???  It all was corrected after their frustration.  Table was full of numbers people so.....yeah.  Saved $30 per person...worth it.

Overall, the spot is nice and the food ok for the price point and experience.

Go once and say you went.

If you go don't do the Tomahawk.  Get at the A5 if you can and balance that with the seafood.

First of all, the food is good and fresh but the dining experience will be good ONLY IF you reserve the right menu option. We had the $159/person menu Without Grill on table  although the menu we got as well as the web clearly says $149/person( kind of misleading). First round we tried the JP A5 Ribeyes and Striploin which both melts in your mouth with an aroma that is indeed A grade JP Wagyu beef. We also grab some crab legs from the station and crab meat is warm and fresh. Everything seems to be good for the first 30 minutes and then things went south. It took them 30 minutes to get the 2nd round of the Wagyu steak from the kitchen AFTER we complained to the waiter for wait 20 minutes for nothing. Although the waiter and the manager did manage to get the steak speed up later on, even offering free drinks, we ended up with lots of Wagyu steaks on the table at the same time and it soon became too overwhelming while eating too much oily steak for such a short period of time. Till the end, we realized that we never even get the lobster tail we ordered earlier while they will never forget your appetizers. As for the dessert, they have a limited selection of cake flavors. Make sure you order the ones you like in between the dining otherwise you might not be able to get the flavor you want at the end. Overall, crab labs are good, shrimp is okay,  sashimi is average but at least they all taste fresh. A5 Wagyu only the Premium 5 oz Wagyu Worth the try but not the special Wagyu cut. If you like seafood, just go with the basic menu option. If you want Wagyu, make sure you reserve the table WITH GRILL or you will get GRILLED. By the way, for the owner, you need to update your website about the pricing otherwise it is misleading for the table with or without a grill. Let‚Äôs start with the service, which was the highlight of the evening. Our server, Nate, was excellent‚Äîhe explained everything clearly, was always available to take our order, and ensured our water glasses were never empty. Plates were promptly cleared, making for a smooth dining experience.

Now, onto the most important part: the food. Unfortunately, it didn‚Äôt live up to our expectations, especially considering the price. The Alaskan King Crab was particularly disappointing‚Äîit would be more accurate to call it ‚ÄúAlaskan Baby Crab.‚Äù

I have mixed feelings about Niki X‚Äôs buffet. There is no doubt that the cuts are high quality and luxurious, but the meal wasn‚Äôt exactly enjoyable or delicious. There was an extreme lack of side dishes that you would  expect of a buffet. There was no fruit and very little vegetable options. Dessert options sucked. This meant you had nothing to balance out the extremely fatty cuts. Maybe it‚Äôs because they were not originally designed to be a buffet so they had very little space to spread the food items available for self-service, but the result is one feel almost sickened by the heaviness of the meal at the end of it.

They were also blasting k-pop music which, while I normally enjoy, did not really help in creating a ‚Äúpremium‚Äù experience because they were intentionally picked to be upbeat and high-speed songs. These songs are more suited for a bar or fast food setting and I felt like the choice was to rush customers out of the door.

Service left me a little confused. Everyone was professional, but they did not have an option for coat check in a closet when the entire restaurant is very smoky from the grill. The seating was also pretty weird; if you go as two people you have to sit next to each other which can become pretty crowded.

First, let me say that my husband and I traveled from Texas to celebrate our Birthday at this restaurant. He is a seafood foodie so it was one of his special birthday requests to fly to LA and eat here. The atmosphere was dimly lit, kind of intimate in appearance however you are seated with others and not at a private table. The music was a bit loud so conversation had to be louder. We had an amazing waiter JJ who was nothing but TOP NOTCH all night long!! The food was not worth the price unfortunately üòï. The seafood was cold seafood. I'm used to my crab legs being hot and boiled with flavor. My husband loves all kinds hot or cold seafood and he said it was sub par. The Wagyu Beef requires a special pallette because it was very greasy. And the desserts were not sweet at all and were just horrible. I felt really cheated on what was supposed to be a superior experience! And for the cost of this experience....when you travel this far for a birthday experience....well let's just say I am super disappointed. Our waiter sent over the manager, who was super nice and very understanding, provided an alternative for food options, however we were really already over it. He provided us a 60$ discount which still made the experience cost 160$ plus the 16.50 for parking. I do not recommend this experience unless you specifically like cold seafood and wagyu beef. But i will always recommend JJ our waiter! Thank you guys and hope this helps! Food: 1 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 3

This restaurant is under the same brand as  Xpot so the meat quality is great and maintained their usual standard. Specializing in wagyu, all meat is fatty with that perfect marble. The pickles side dish is a great balance.

We ordered Prix fixe menu and get to enjoy different cuts. The portion is alright. For 2 of us, we weren‚Äôt really full after the meal so we ordered another tomahawk tasting menu. But this one we couldn‚Äôt finish it all.

Although the presentation is nice and interior design is fancy. I personally find it a bit overpriced. Some presentation is just for show and social media, I understand the marketing strategy but couldn‚Äôt appreciate it. It‚Äôs a good choice for celebration and events. This is good for a one time thing. I paid after tips and two drinks $410 for booth seating. I picked 2 $149 options, I couldn‚Äôt justify it if it wasn‚Äôt my birthday haha, the food was very good. The service was great, the portions per serving were a little small but reasonable for unlimited style. You‚Äôre able to pick two cuts of meat at a time and as many sides as you want, I filled my table to the brim with food to make my moneys worth. But I still feel like I only got 80% of my value back, they did not slow me down but the cut off time did catch up to me.

They have a cut off for cooked dishes from the kitchen 1 and a half hours into your 2 hour time. It‚Äôs odd but not unreasonable, I was given a a drink for free which was nice. I can say I would go again but I would choose the $109 buffet seating rather than the steak house seating. Hubster and I visited for our 27th wedding anniversary and we were BLOWN AWAY!  Perfect service (they actually carried in a bench seat for us because the chairs were too narrow) all the food was amazing! But I highly suggest the Chilean Sea Bass wraps! Life changing!!! The sashimi was THE best I've had in SoCal.  We loved that they had warm butter on tap (I would have preferred it to not be garlic butter) The steaks absolutely ruined me for all future steaks! Melt in your mouth doesn't do it justice.  I expected to focus on the lobster tail but to be honest, I was a little disappointed in them. I tried 3 different tails and none of them were easy to remove from the shell even though they were all cut down the back. The flavor was good however and they were nice sized. The star of the night was by far the Chilean Sea Bass!!! Do not skip it! We paid $119 each plus $16 for valet parking (loved that option) and we considered it completely worth every penny. Even if its only a once in a lifetime visit, you should definitely go! Our birthday celebration at Niku X was excellent.

Darren was so attentive, helpful, and friendly. We didn't have to look around for him to place our orders or ask questions. I loved his friendly and approachable smile. In addition to Darren, there was one other gentleman that helped us a lot, I neglected to obtain his name. Our water glass and drinks were never empty, table was never overcrowded with plates, and our grill was changed multiple times just in time.

The food was excellent. The seafood, sushi, meats, special dishes, and dessert were so fresh. The portion were also the perfect sizes. It was our sons first time. They loved it and we plan to go back for another birthday celebration. Can't even rank the food, since they were all so good!

So glad we saved dessert for last. The egg tarts were amazing. I want more!

Let‚Äôs talk about Niku X‚Äîbecause at around $150 per person, you expect an extravagant experience. What I found was something just shy of that.

Ambiance & Service (4.5/5): The restaurant sits a few floors up, and our dinner with another couple started off smoothly‚Äîwe were seated immediately with a reservation at a window table overlooking the street. The layout is thoughtfully arranged with enough space for movement and wheelchair access. It can host everything from small parties to large groups (we saw a table of ~20). The ambiance is upscale, modern, and lively, though the bathrooms felt underwhelming‚Äîsmall, limited stalls, and the trash was overflowing.
Service overall was attentive. Our waiter was friendly, offered great recommendations, and staff were quick to help when we accidentally spilled a drink‚Äîcleaning it up professionally and replacing it without question. Plenty of servers and even managers circulate the floor to assist. At this price point, I would have expected the premium cuts to be cooked table-side by staff rather than us, but that‚Äôs more of a missed opportunity than a dealbreaker.

Food: The wagyu was solid‚Äîhard to get wrong, and I‚Äôd give it a 4.5/5 so long as cuts aren‚Äôt too thick or thin. Seafood, however, was mixed. The carpaccio was fresh and flavorful, but the king crab legs were small, dry, and more effort than reward. Bibs would have been a thoughtful touch given the mess factor. The snow crab legs, on the other hand, were the highlight of the night‚Äîwe kept going back for more. Still, the overall spread left me wanting more variety, particularly in veggies, fruit, and dessert. At this price, I‚Äôd expect at least a fruit bar and a stronger dessert selection.

Overall: Niku X delivers a refined dining experience with polished service and a strong ambiance, but at $150 a head, I expected a bit more across the board‚Äîespecially on seafood variety and premium touches like tableside grilling. Worth a visit for the snow crab legs and the wagyu, but not quite the fully extravagant experience I anticipated. The snow crab legs, on the other hand, were the highlight of the night‚Äîwe kept going back for more. Still, the overall spread left me wanting more variety, particularly in veggies, fruit, and dessert. At this price, I‚Äôd expect at least a fruit bar and a stronger dessert selection.

Overall: Niku X delivers a refined dining experience with polished service and a strong ambiance, but at $150 a head, I expected a bit more across the board‚Äîespecially on seafood variety and premium touches like tableside grilling. Worth a visit for the snow crab legs and the wagyu, but not quite the fully extravagant experience I anticipated. A5 Wagyu Heaven ‚Äî Worth Every Penny

The $149 all-you-can-eat A5 Wagyu beef experience at Niku is absolutely worth it. This isn‚Äôt just dinner‚Äîit‚Äôs a culinary event. The cheaper tier lets you cook the meat yourself, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend that‚Äîespecially if you‚Äôre like me and don‚Äôt even enjoy cooking at home. Ruining such delicate, premium beef would feel like a crime.

There‚Äôs a wide range of offerings beyond beef‚Äîseafood, sushi, sashimi, caviar, lobster, and more. But trust me:

Come hungry.
Start with the A5 Wagyu beef‚Äîdon‚Äôt get distracted by other dishes too early.
Stick firmly to your preferred doneness, even if the waiter suggests otherwise.
After trying at least two A5 Wagyu cuts, then go all out on everything else.

Their miso soup is rich and comforting, and the other beef cuts are also delicious. The desserts, though? Honestly, underwhelming‚Äîbland and forgettable.

Service has been consistently excellent on all my visits. Book well in advance‚Äîthis is a rare dining experience. They claim to be the only one of its kind in the country, and I believe it‚ÄîI haven‚Äôt seen anything like this elsewhere. Niku X definitely lived up to the hype. Jerry was our server and he was amazing through our whole experience, start to finish. Very knowledgeable about the menu, both food and drinks and continued to help us pick great options. Daniel (I believe Im remembering his name right) at the host stand was also really nice and very accommodating when our table was taking longer to be ready than our reservation time.

We got the premium menu (priced at $159 pp; recently increased and not properly reflected on their whole website and certain physical menus) which included the seafood buffet and all of the steak cuts.  The steaks were all delicious, from the domestic Wagyu to the delicious JP A5, and the self serve seafood buffet was full enough that everyone could find something to enjoy. They also had restock times for some of the more popular items as well as utensils like seafood scissors and crab crackers which were necessities.

I‚Äôd definitely take some time to consider what you‚Äôre going to want to get and when‚Äîlike getting a buffet plate and enjoying what you got first before ordering some steak‚Äîso you don‚Äôt let certain foods get cold or cross flavors you may not have intended to, which was a slight issue I had figured may (and did) happen, but that didn‚Äôt take away from the food quality.

Great overall experience from the whole staff. I‚Äôd go again simply to enjoy the experience differently, maybe at one of the KBBQ style table grills or just ordering my dinner differently, but if you‚Äôre thinking about giving it a go and/or concerned about the price point, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth your while at least once to see and judge for yourself ! We‚Äôve been dining at Niku X for the past nine months, and each visit continues to impress. This is easily one of the best high-end dining experiences in Los Angeles.

The A5 Wagyu is the undisputed highlight‚Äîexpertly grilled tableside, incredibly tender, and full of rich flavor. We‚Äôre also big fans of the shrimp and lobster tails‚Äîalways fresh and satisfying. Don‚Äôt miss the Miso Chilean Seabass wrap (ordered separately)‚Äîa buttery, melt-in-your-mouth bite that‚Äôs absolutely worth it.

We first met Cody at the Little Tokyo Chubby Cattle location and were happy to see him here. He always makes us feel welcome‚Äîlike a friend ensuring we enjoy every aspect of the meal. Wilson was our main server and was fantastic throughout‚Äîattentive, professional, and warm.

One note: premium seafood items like king crab and lobster tails are replenished on a schedule. At this price point, continuous availability would be more fitting. Also, pre-shelled lobster tail would improve the overall dining ease.

We‚Äôve been Chubby Club members for a few months now, and it‚Äôs a great value for those who dine here often. Valet parking with validation is currently $24 (up from $16.50 nine months ago), still reasonable considering the regular $54 rate without validation.

Reservations are highly recommended‚Äîuse OpenTable to secure a spot. The dining experience is limited to 120 minutes, so plan accordingly.

Exceptional food, top-tier service, and a sleek, modern ambiance make Niku X a must-try. We‚Äôll absolutely be back. For a whole restaurant chain known to focus on Japanese Waygu, Niku X is supposed to be one of their flagships. To that end they deliver on the vibe and experience, but the food is rougher.

Overall the buffet is high quality, but the Waygu options, at least on the regular buffet menu, are decidedly meh - they have other Chubby Group restaurant brands that do a better job for the money. If you go for the higher end menu the experience is likely better but then you‚Äôre even more of a premium. Combined with the fact that reservations are so hard to get and I am decidedly meh.

Final note, service is indeed excellent, and Joe, our server, was terrific. We visited Niku x in between Christmas and New Year's. Perfect timing. Went right when they opened. Made a reservation about a month in advance but at that time you didn't need one. The atmosphere was really good but not what I expected for the price.

The buffet food was plentiful and had great flavors. Lots of crab legs, limited Sushi but lots of things you could order from a menu that were included in your meal price.

The service was fantastic. Our server was wonderful. She gave us lots of tips on what to order from the menu and how to order from the menu. If you are celebrating a birthday, great place to go and always ask for a slushie at the end. That was the best surprise of the evening.

The slices of wagyu beef are one to two bites. You can get as much wagyu beef as you like. However, they do have a 30% waste fee if they see that you are taking more food than you can eat.

It was a nice experience and gift for my family for Christmas. Special occasions I would go again. Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

LArge venue in a cool area, just above the street with a view of the streets of downtown. When you enter, the Host area is right by the buffet line, which can cause some congestion for those looking to grab their bites. The line itself is crammed on one side of a walkway which also leads to other dining areas, the restroom and the service entrance to the kitchen.
The rest of the venue is spacious and comfortable.
The line starts with a selection of apps, with sushi, ceviche and other items. It follows by a selection of raw Wagyu beef, then ending with the 'premium' seafood selection. While the apps and Wagyu selections were fresh and tasty, the seafood selections were nothing to be desired, tasting 'cheap' in comparison to the other options.

Service was on point! I had a server named Joe C, with another server helping named Wilson, always available or visible when needed but not overwhelmingly. The servers brought out additional meats that were cooked to perfection right at the table, with a detailed explanation of each type and the best way to enjoy with various sauces. Staff kept up with table maintenance, always asking to clear instead of removing dishes in a hurry. We did not feel rushed and felt that the servers did pay proper attention to service rather than the 'flip and dip' service of many area restaurants. I recently dined at Niku X and had a positive experience overall. The wagyu was fantastic, the seafood was mostly very delicious, and the sides that you order from the kitchen were all very good as well. Being a huge seafood fan, I was primarily interested in eating the various fish and shellfish options. While I really enjoyed 90% of the seafood selection, I will say that the crab and lobster were a bit underwhelming. One of the crabs (can't remember which kind) was very salty, while the lobster had a somewhat rubbery texture. Aside from the seafood, the beef options were all fantastic and melt-in-your-mouth. The cocktails were well-made and delicious, but seemed light on alcohol. We also ordered a couple of soft drinks, which were fairly expensive and not a good value ($6 for a tiny glass bottle of Coke). The service was very good throughout the entire dining experience and I was impressed that the servers came to change our grill often without us asking. The primary reason I am taking off a star from my review is that our server essentially bribed us into giving him a good review on Yelp by offering to comp our soft drinks. I assumed that meant we could write him a good review on our own terms, but instead he took our phones, copied and pasted an AI-generated review on Yelp, and asked us to post it. It was honestly quite uncomfortable and it makes me question how legitimate the other reviews are for this establishment. Just something to be aware of. Otherwise, I really enjoyed the meal and would recommend Niku X to other seafood and wagyu lovers. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Miso Chilean Sea Bass, Wagyu Tartare

Enjoyed dinner with a party of 7 tonight. Kevin was our server, he was knowledgeable of the different cuts of meat and cooking techniques for each. I have dined at a few Chubby Cattle Restaurants and there are a few items I would like to see improved at this sister company; such as cleanliness of grills (grill was black with previous diners cooked food' also and allergy risk)upon seating  and cleanliness of bathrooms( were one of the first seated customer for dinner at 5pm and bathroom was filhty and trash was overflowing), better variety of desserts and birthday celebration offerings such as a plated dessert with happy birthday signs. Cocktail shrimps and shelled prawns were overcooked, Alaskan Crab legs seasoned well but also sadly overcooked. Lobster was cooked well. Sashimi was fresh. Salad bar and raw vegetables lacked in variety for the price point.

My experience at NikuX was truly exceptional. From the moment we arrived, the front desk staff was remarkably kind. Kevin, who was in charge of our table, provided attentive and courteous service, and his recommendation of the Miso Chilean Seabass was even better than Nobu‚Äôs. Each dish was fresh and made with evident care.

I was particularly impressed by how Kevin and the floor manager consistently checked in on our meal throughout the dining experience. Their willingness to listen to even minor feedback was something I had not encountered in any other buffet, which left a lasting impression.

It was a rare opportunity to enjoy a satisfying luxury buffet in LA. Personally, I found NikuX to be a more valuable dining experience than the buffet at Cafe S in H Hotel, in terms of quality, pricing, and service.
Thank you. Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

**BEWARE**
If you're going for the buffet, make sure you make a reservation if possible! Otherwise, you'll end up sitting at the bar and obligated to take the $139 option (that's what happened to my group of 4), And me being someone who doesn't love seafood, the $139 option is overpriced for me. But honestly, I think it was the better experience, even though it was our first time there and we missed out on being able to cook our own food. The bartenders Joseph (and I forgot the other guys name... sorry üò¨) were awesome! They were so attentive and helpful in the food selection process. On top of that, they were great conversationalists and artists of concoctions. Even the other staff members that crossed our path were really cool. It was like we sat in the VIP area and were the only ones there! üòÇ All the food was delicious and there were many top notch meat selections. The sea bass is a MUST try! üíãüëåüèº The vibe is casual but classy. (Heads up, though, they only play K-Pop so if you go I hope you're either a fan or don't mind.) It was an experience and I would definitely go back! A must try experience - great quality meat and seafood!

Booked full service for 2 ($139pp) on a Thursday night. Arrived a few minutes late due to LA traffic - NikuX is located in the same building as the Intercontinental hotel in DTLA, on the second floor. Seated within 5 minutes in a nice window seat.

With the full-service menu, you get to order unlimited amounts of everything on the menu and some special items once.

Unlimited items: some items require preparation and you need to order the day before your reservation, such as the 45-day aged tomahawk - which we ordered. When we sat down, we immediately ordered Japanese A5 ribeye and tenderloin.

What we liked:
- Japanese A5 steaks - sliced thin, good quality, not a lot in each serving but because of the heavy fat content it fills you up quickly!
- Wagyu fried rice - whoever is working the wok on the rice is doing a great job!
- Unlimited lobster tails and king crab legs at the buffet - served chilled on ice, but supplied with lemons and butter and very fresh. And they‚Äôve cut the lobster tails in half to make it even easier to eat.
- Miso Sea bass - served in ‚Äúcubes‚Äù that were pan fried and served on a skewer. Very tasty

Not fans of:
- Shishito pepper

The special items (limited to one per person)
- Sashimi special - uni, toro, salmon, caviar - what‚Äôs not to like? Very tasty. Small portion but it was very good. I had both portions for the two of us that went‚Ä¶yum!
- King crab stuffed - served hot - very good
- Big head shrimp - served hot - also very good

Buffet - shrimp, other wagyu food options, like curry, fresh salad, vegetables, tempura - all unlimited and self-serve. Good selection.

Cocktails / wine - expansive menu - prices are about what you would expect for LA prices.

Service - Wissal was our server - very friendly - informative and professional. Thanks for a great time! In terms of the food service, honestly it was a bit slow. I know you get 2 hours to eat but we often sat 15-20 minutes with no steak despite ordering. That would probably be my only point of negative feedback. Quality was great. We left super full - but the long lag times to get cooked steak out on the full-service option was a bit disappointing. Next time, I might skip the full service and just get the self-service and cook my own meat over a Korean BBQ and take the wagyu they had at the buffet.

Now - if you make it to the end and you still have room for dessert - you can try it. Their tiny dessert station didn‚Äôt have anything great in my opinion. We tried a few things and were underwhelmed. But hey - we were already bursting at the seams from all the Wagyu :)

A must try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Fried Rice, King Crab and Snow Crab Legs, Premium Seafood, Tomahawk Wagyu

Beautiful restaurant with excellent service, and the food was well worth the price! We opted for the VIP treatment where you didn't have to cook your own food.  Their American wagyu and Japanese A5 were to die for, so delicious and tender! This alone made it worth the trip! And then there's the  Raw oysters and sashimi which were super fresh! Their snow crab legs and lobster tails were so so good dipped in their lemon garlic butter sauce. Chilean sea bass was very tasty and cooked perfectly. I will say that I had a couple items I tried that didn't quite satisfy, but I still give this place 5 stars because the food I did eat most of were GREAT AND THE SERVICE was AMAZING. Thank you Mikey!  One of the things I wasn't too happy with lamb lollipop, which lasted much flavor. Another was the tomahawk steak because some of it was a little tough and didn't compare to the A5 tenderloin.  But then again, nothing compared to the A5 Tenderloin, IMO.  Also, they didn't have too much of a dessert selection.  We had a 9:15 pm reservation, so it's likely we came too late to enjoy a spread of sweets. But since I was so stuffed with all the unbelievably good food, I didn't mind skipping dessert. All in all, I highly recommend this place and can't wait to go again! Had a reservation for 2 for Niku X on Friday night at 9:30 PM. Niku X is located in the Wilshire-Grand Building on the 2nd floor on the opposite side of the Intercontinenal Hotel. Found street parking on Figueroa & 6th. We took the escalators up and were about 20 minutes early, we were greeted by the hostess and led to the waiting area and given a drinks menu. Originally our reservation was for the $99 option but we decided to do the $139 instead (unfortunately we did not get to do the tomahawk that is part of the $139 option as we needed to preorder by 1:30 PM). We waited about 5 minutes and were led to our giant table with a grill in the center. Mikey introduced himself to us as our server and he was cool, friendly and very attentive along with the other staff.

To start off there is the self-serve buffet style salad bar (NIKU salad, mushrooms & zucchini for grilling, seafood salad, kimchi, fruit), then the crudo bar (wagyu tartare, bluefin tuna toro w/ scallion, salmon, A5 wagyu tartare, amberjack, halibut, scallop, ceviche), then the hot foods (white rice topped with furikake, wagyu curry, wagyu mapo tofu, fried veggies, shrimp tempura and then the meat locker (Japanese A5 chef's choice steak, Japanese A5 top sirloin, American Wagyu Ribeye, American Wagyu Striploin, American Wagyu Tenderloin) and then the chilled seafood (oysters, scallops, lobster tail, snow crab legs & king crab legs) and the condiments (lemon, cajun butter, pink peppercorn mignonette & yuzu cocktail sauce) and lastly a small dessert section.

There were items on the menu that you had to order through your server. We tried the potato pave, oxtail potstickers, A5 wagyu sando, miso Chilean sea bass, wagyu tallow shishito peppers, wagyu sukiyaki, and lamb lollipop. Because of the $139 option we were each allowed to order 1 item from the Chef's Special Seafood so we chose the ultimate sashimi platter (assorted sashimi, uni, foie gras, caviar) and sushi platter which was incredible. The quality of fish was very fresh, each piece of sushi was dabbed with a little sauce/tare and the slightly acidic vinegar rice was perfect and really opened up the appetite.

The meat what can I say? Every single piece melted in the mouth, after a slight sear on both sides of the beef and got great maillard reaction. You can season your meat with the condiments at the table  (salt, pepper, chili powder, wasabi salt, house blend, truffle salt). Our favorites were definitely the Japanese cuts, they were VERY rich and a little goes a long way but it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout being able to enjoy small dishes of quality seafood from the crudo bar or some salad  in between the rich meat and most definitely the seafood... not many places offer king crab legs so this is legit, crab crackers and crab shears provided as well, the crab meat were both so naturally sweet with a bit of brininess from the salt water, id say the crab legs alone make it worth it, just go to Costco and take a look at the cooked red king crab legs. I didn't try any of the desserts or hot food items except for the wagyu fried rice and shrimp tempura but I'll definitely be back to enjoy the full experience, hopefully with an earlier reservation time.

Also, this is a restaurant part of the Chubby Group (Chubby Cattle, Chubby Curry, Wagyu House, Yumiyaki, Mikiya, Chubby Skewers) so make sure you get the app and points! We visited Niku X for their new lobster and wagyu seafood buffet yesterday, and it was fantastic! Even before the doors opened, there was already a line, which shows how popular it is.

The buffet offers two price options, $99 and $139, both worth it for the unlimited lobster, A5 wagyu, oysters, and king crab legs. The food was fresh and delicious, and there's also a variety of hot dishes, sashimi, and desserts--including cakes from a collaboration with Freesia bakery.

A highlight was the Yakitsuki, cooked fresh and melting in your mouth, though it's limited to one per person. The chef's specials, like miso Chilean sea bass and wagyu sando, were also outstanding.

The service was attentive, and the atmosphere elegant yet cozy. If you're a lobster lover, this buffet is a must-try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Tartare

Unless you‚Äôre vegetarian, you will love your experience at Niku X. They have beautiful aesthetics and a high attention to detail. The interior architecture is modern and elegant, while the decorations and food presentation compliment these themes. The staff are very kind, though one of them acted a bit informal. Our server was very friendly, which I love in a course meal, being able to chat with them during the experience. The only downside of the space is that the restaurant was playing upbeat music which was loud. It was a bit bothersome and was hard to hear the servers explaining each course.
Onto the food, I highly recommend the course meals because these are experiences designed from beginning to last and they give you a full experience. I chose the lower priced menu because the starters felt more appealing, and they definitely hit the spot. All the dishes throughout the night are very rich, overflowing with umami flavors from ingredients like truffle, Wagyu, and egg yolk. At the same time, the chefs at Niku X know to pair these fatty beef cuts with acidic garnishes like lemon and ume, which helps balance out the intensity. I can nitpick a few things, but that is after understanding that the whole meal was amazing. With the tenderloin, they present it on a small, soft slice of bread and this portion was hard to eat without it all falling apart. The sukiyaki had a whole shiso leaf with it to eat, and that was overbearing over the rest of the ingredients.
If you are looking for a premium dinner experience, definitely look to Niku X to be pampered with an incredibly enjoyable night. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Recommended dishes

I recently had the absolute pleasure of dining at NIKU X in downtown LA, and I cannot emphasize enough just how incredible the experience was. From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were welcomed by a warm and luxurious atmosphere that promised a truly high-end dining experience.

One of the most impressive aspects of NIKU X is their extraordinary use of ingredients. Their signature dish, which combines the finest wayu beef with an innovative blend of caviar, is nothing short of a culinary masterpiece. The fusion of flavors and textures was a delightful surprise that left our taste buds dancing with excitement.

Now, let me tell you about our server, Robert. His exceptional service was the cherry on top of an already perfect evening. Robert's professionalism and expertise were evident from the moment he introduced himself to us. He guided us through each course with meticulous explanations and cooking demonstrations that showcased his extensive knowledge and passion for the cuisine. It was an interactive and educational experience that made the meal even more enjoyable.

Robert's attentive and personable demeanor made us feel like VIP guests. He managed to strike the perfect balance between being available for our needs and giving us space to enjoy our meal. We truly appreciated his genuine enthusiasm and warmth, which only added to the overall charm of NIKU X.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly give NIKU X and our server Robert a well-deserved five-star rating. Their unparalleled culinary creations, coupled with Robert's exceptional service, made for a dining experience that will forever be etched in our memories. If you're looking for a high-end dining experience that will transport your senses to new heights, look no further than NIKU X in downtown LA. We can't wait to return! Niku X is the premier date spot and dinner experience. I can't recommend it enough. I took my girlfriend here as a part of a larger anniversary weekend and we both thoroughly enjoyed our experience. We both are already wanting to go back!

We did the tasting menu, which was coursed out over 2 hours or so. Additionally, we ordered some a la carte items and drinks (they now have their liquor license, which I had seen some recent reviews saying they didn't yet).

Food:

The first course was sashimi, which was actually one of favorites. The fish was so fresh and it had some jelly on top, which added a next level of flavor to the dish. We then were served our a la carte items, which were the wagyu bone marrow and 1000 layer potato. The wagyu bone marrow is a must! The bread alone is worth it, but the bone marrow itself is the best I have had.

The caviar, uni, and wagyu dish seems excessive from the extent that it is so many luxury items together in one dish, though it is amazing. It genuinely tastes like something out of this world. The uni was so fresh and the caviar was the perfect balance of flavor and saltiness. Together with the side items that are served with the dish, it is complemented really well.

The wagyu tray of various cuts of meats is the star of the show, both according to visuals and taste. The cuts of meat are all cooked and served by the waitstaff, which are explained in detail. Each piece was somehow better than the last.

the final course of a5 wagyu on toast with blueberry jam and foie gras, was good, but I think ti could have been a little better. I think the flavors complemented each other very well, but knowing how a5 tastes by itself, it made me wanting more out of the dish a little. I wanted to taste the richness of the meat and I though that was lacking from the dish. The dish itself was great, but it felt like deep down I was missing something, since I know all of the ingredients separately.

Drinks:

The Matcha Colada was great, especially if you like matcha. It was fresh matcha and definitely blended well with the coconut. I would recommend it for matcha lovers.

The margarita was probably one of the best margaritas that I have had ANYWHERE in LA. It was that good. Definitely a 10/10 for me.

Ume Raba was good, but my 3rd ranked from the bunch. It was refereshing, but not really my style.

As a bonus, they serve oolong tea as a palette cleanser mid-meal, which was great. I will unashamedly admit I had 4 cups of tea.

Dessert:

Matcha dessert was super rich, but delicious. I liked it a lot. It was similar to a matcha ice cream, with powdered matcha around it. My girlfriend thought the matcha flavor was too rich, though I thought it was perfect.

The creme br√ªl√©e was the better of the two dishes as was the textbook definition of an ideal dessert in my opinion. Only only downside is that it is pretty small.

Service:

Service was tip tier, like you would find in a Michelin restaurant. The servers were knowledgeable and friendly, especially about the dishes and what they were preparing for us.

Overall:

The food was all top tier and I have no doubt that this place will receive a Michelin Star in the near future. If someone asked me what I wanted to eat every day for the rest of my life, it would be this place. I would happily do so.

I now dream to do the tomahawk experience next. Hopefully sometime soon. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Valet parking at the Interncontinental hotel, which came out to $16.50
