I tried the Yakiniku Testing Menu. All the appetizers were delicious, with fresh and high-quality ingredients. Even the soup and salad were very particular. The waiters were very professional and humorous in grilling, and they would explain each dish one by one. The special Japanese charcoal grill was a big plus. The grilled meat items were a bit greasy, but the Jinxuan tea was just enough to relieve the greasiness and make you want to come back to try other dishes!

Niku X is not to be missed!
If you are looking for the highest quality dishes, a beautiful layout, or a secluded private room for a party or event -- this is the quintessential place to go. It‚Äôs like no other.

The moment you walk through their doors you are immediately greeted with a view of an immense kitchen, curated by Michelin Star Chef Shin Thompson. You can watch your meal being carefully prepared. It‚Äôs stunning.

Our fantastic waiter Chaeho did a phenomenal job presenting each elegant dish and conversing with us throughout our meal. We felt at home with his personal stories and interesting insights. Our superb assistant waitress, Phoebe, who helped bring out some of the dishes was very professional and sweet. The entire staff at this restaurant are top quality professionals.

Our first course, crudo, was very fresh and a perfect start to our meal. The astrea oscietra caviar, paired with senbei cracker and topped with gold leaf was astounding and a treat to the taste buds. I have never had such a beautiful visual as well as sensory moment. There was no heaviness, only pleasure with each bite. The black winter truffle was presented in a Louis Vuitton mini suitcase, and shaved onto the meat. Now I know what it feels like to be presented with an award!

The style and story behind each plate reflected the precision and passion of the kitchen. It‚Äôs obvious that the staff love what they do. I felt as though I was in an edible art gallery; the balance of texture and color was so artistic.

My favorite dish was the wagu platter, not just for the breathtaking display, but each cut of meat touched my tongue with intense flavor. To continue the journey, every course had a different palate cleanser with its own sensation.

The price is worth the entire experience. It is very special and one of a kind unique. I recommend it for an exceptional date night, or a gathering. I will never forget it. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+

NIKU X is a must try! We first heard about NIKU X on TikTok and realized that we've been to one of their sister companies, Chubby Cattle in Las Vegas. If you haven't been, it is also a must try when you're in sin city!

Located on the 2nd floor of the Intercontinental hotel. You won't get lost, there's a bunch of signs telling you where to go via escalator or elevator.

We got the Yakiniku Tasting Menu which includes appetizers, yakiniku, and dessert. Every dish was very decadent and umami from start to finish -- the uni, caviar and wagyu tartare dish to the different types of wagyu from the US, Australia, and Japan. You'll leave wanting more of the toriyama sandwich with foie gras and milk bread.

Besides the food, the vibe and the service by Mama J was phenomenal - she was funny and also attentive to make our experience one-of-a-kind. Thanks again for the lovely service and delicious food. We will be back soon to try out the Tomahawk Tasting Menu! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Parking Located on the 2nd floor at the Intercontinental Hotel. What an experience!!! Had the pleasure of enjoying the tasting menu at Niku X. The menu items were curated nicely. We were greeted with welcoming smiles and seated promptly even thought we arrived a little early for our reservation. The staff was very accommodating and informative of the experience, menu items and aging process of the meat. The way the staff moved around and made things happen felt so "top secret" and movie-like.. I absolutely loved the vibe.
The food was literally works of art presented on platters. Just picture perfect and indulgent at the same time. The food was wonderful, rich and again a well planned adventure. I LOVE that some of our humongous (and delicious) steak was used to prepare our fried rice later in the meal. Some of my favorite dishes were the salad, oxtail wontons, 16 layer potato stack and the Bone marrow. (That's like everything lol)
Oh and PLEASE slather your steak in the egg sauce ... AH-mazing!! (I poured a bit over my fried rice too)
If you are up for a foodie adventure, definitely visit Niku X.  Perfect for a special occasion as well!
There were other items I wanted to try on the menu but the portions on the tasting menu were perfectly filling.
I Will definitely return sooner than later cause I had my eye on the Uni caviar dish!

Plenty of self parking in the parking garage or just valet at the Hotel. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner

We had an amazing time at Niku X! The entire staff was very welcoming and friendly and our server Wissal took us to an amazing journey with the Chef's tasting menu! The Wagyu A5 ribye with the rice Donabe was absolutely delicious! Can't wait to be back!

I absolutely love this new restaurant in downtown LA! Grilled meat and rare seafood selection, Japanese style with a contemporary approach. Best yakiniku spot hands down. The meat quality is just insane!

Quality, presentation and hospitality are beyond excellent and over the top! Super delicious, super friendly. You're gonna get the full treatment here like you would in Japan. The atmosphere here felt like an upscale but really casual place that's good for every occasion and large groups.

The servers were super attentive and expertly navigated us through all our courses, explaining the different cuts of meat as well as cooked everything for us! We also got a special presentation by the master chef himself! You can tell my his upbeat attitude and professionalism that he's really passionate and driven to provide an amazing experience for us with his team. They've got something really special going on here for LA! Don't walk, run carefully there!

The servers were really friendly. We felt welcomed and taken care of.  We usually dine in some of LA‚Äôs premiere steakhouses so we were looking forward to something a little unusual and fun. I‚Äôm very pleased with our experience! It was far from other Japanese restaurants we‚Äôve been to. The menu was well conceptualized, there was a perfect balance between the appetizers, vegetables, meat cuts and delectable desserts. Would highly recommend this place.

Negative.Context:
Over rated, over priced, and such a huge disappointing. This was supposed to be the highlight of our trip to LA. Instead it became the worst part of it.
We sat at a table without a grill - meaning our food was to be prepped by a chef and delivered to us instead of us cooking it ourselves (Korean bbq style). What I thought this meant was the food would be prepped to perfection and our service would be a lot better since the price difference was $50 per person. Instead we got cooked meat delivered to us cold, the slowest service I have ever seen at any restaurant, and pretty much the worst experience I have had in a very very long time. Every single time we ordered meat it came to our table cold. But because wagyu is so high in fat, the fat didn‚Äôt ‚Äúmelt in our mouth‚Äù it felt like we were chewing sticks of butter/lard. Dish after dish came this way. I was nearly about to lose my mind until we finally decided that we were both just done and ready to leave. That made me feel a lot better to just give up on the experience and decide to escape the place entirely.  The manager came by and asked if we were doing ok but it was only by the time we were about to ask for our check after the entire horrendous experience and leave. So he was too late. Nothing really happened after he heard about our experience. He said sorry and that he hoped he could make it right but we only had one more serving of meat left from our earlier order so there was really nothing he could have done except maybe make sure the last two tiny portions of meat don‚Äôt come out stone cold.
Their buffet food was very low quality, the service was super slow, and the price was really too high for what you get.

I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with the experience I had with this restaurant‚Äôs reservation system and management. We made a reservation two weeks ago, and the staff confirmed it multiple times, they took down our name, phone number, and email, and assured us that our reservation was confirmed.

When we called today to reconfirm, we were told that there was no record of our reservation. To make matters worse, the manager we spoke with was very unhelpful and unwilling to provide any appropriate support or solution.

This level of disorganization and lack of customer care is unacceptable for a restaurant of this caliber. We had planned our evening around this reservation and were left extremely disappointed. I hope management takes this feedback seriously and improves both their reservation system and customer service going forward. Service: 1

‚≠ê‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Extremely Disappointed ‚Äì Special Celebration Ruined

We made a reservation at Niku X weeks in advance for a party of 12 to celebrate a dear friend‚Äôs birthday. On the day of the event, the restaurant claimed they had no record of our reservation. This was incredibly upsetting, especially since this was meant to be a special night.

To make matters worse, the manager was very unprofessional and rude when we tried to resolve the issue. Instead of helping us or showing any empathy, they dismissed our concerns entirely. We had to scramble last minute to find another place for our group, which completely ruined the celebration.

I would not recommend Niku X to anyone planning an important occasion. A restaurant of this caliber should know how to manage reservations and treat guests with respect.

The Asian male server with short hair was unbelievably rude and unprofessional. He completely ignored us, even when we called him multiple times, because he was too busy fawning over a large party.

At one point, we were served some meat we didn‚Äôt recognize, so we asked him how we were supposed to eat it. Instead of answering politely, he roughly threw the meat on the grill with his tongs, dipped it forcefully into the sauce in front of me, and then tossed it onto my plate. When I looked at his face, his arrogant and condescending attitude absolutely shocked me.

Being busy is no excuse for showing such disrespect. His fake polite tone couldn‚Äôt hide his cold, dismissive attitude and the clear irritation on his face. It was honestly insulting. This restaurant tries to act high class, but with a server like him, the entire place loses its credibility. One employee like that can completely ruin the atmosphere and my experience here was absolutely ruined because of him. Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

I came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary a few days ago, and while there were some nice moments, our overall experience was very disappointing.

We had a reservation and arrived about ten minutes late, but the staff was kind enough to seat us right away and were very accommodating at first. Unfortunately, the restaurant seemed pretty understaffed that night, which made it difficult to get our waiter‚Äôs attention when we needed anything.

The main attraction here is supposed to be the high-quality meats, but honestly, most of what we were served tasted very similar, and none of it came close to the quality you‚Äôd get at a high-end steakhouse like Baltaire. For a restaurant charging $150 per person, the experience just didn‚Äôt justify the price. The buffet was also limited and felt underwhelming.

The biggest issue, though, came afterward. The shrimp we tried tasted off, and a few hours later both of us became violently ill, with nonstop vomiting and painful stomach issues that lasted through the night. When we called the restaurant to let them know, the only response we received was, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry that happened.‚Äù There was no effort to follow up, investigate, or offer any form of assistance or compensation. This was our third visit to Niku X and what used to be a place we went for special occasions is no longer. I have recommended to so many friends and family members for their special occasions as well. Last night my wife and I celebrated our anniversary and left extremely disappointed. The service and staff were friendly and attentive and our server Emily was great. However, the new buffet style ruins the atmosphere that once was and the experience is just not the same. We ordered the tomahawk tasting menu and requested our steak medium-rare. When it came out and the server sliced it the inside was cold and the steak was practically purple. We are not the type to send something back, but we swallowed our embarrassment and notified the server. Both the server and manager were both extremely apologetic and agreed that the steak should have not been sent out like that. We were told we would get a new steak, but instead the same sliced steak was just put back on the grill so each piece became tough and chewy and lacked flavor. Not what you would expect when you pay $300+ for a steak and $450 for a meal. Unfortunately we don‚Äôt plan to be back and will no longer be recommending this restaurant to our friends and family. Disappointing Food Quality at Niku X
I visited Niku X and have no complaints about the service. The staff were very friendly, cleaned our table promptly, and frequently checked if everything was okay. However, the food was a major letdown. It wasn‚Äôt terrible, but it was far from good. The meat was overly fatty (not same as wagyu that we had in Japan), and the crab was excessively salty, almost as if it was intentionally overseasoned to discourage eating too much.
Initially, I thought $149 was reasonable for high-quality meat, crab, and lobster, but we ended up with portions that felt worth only about $30. Even as someone who doesn‚Äôt eat large portions, I couldn‚Äôt enjoy more than a few bites. I‚Äôm writing this review to save others time and money. You‚Äôre better off dining somewhere else with better quality food and portions that are satisfying, especially if you‚Äôre not a big eater. For a luxury restaurant, it's not just about the food but the whole dining experience. Here are the details:
Reservations for the Chubby insiders (Gold
NFT), who has priority reservations privileges: me.
1 star At reservation via Discord community concierge, it didn't require me to select tomahawk dinner or buffet dinner. I thought it is a decision at dine-in time. OpenTables reservation does request/require the decision (kudos!) This resulted in not getting the meal I made the restaurant reservation for. Mission unaccomplished! Zero (0) stars
Made the reservation at 6:30pm but not at my requested time: 7:30pm. 1 star
Management review 2 stars
The manager came to explain that reservation is required to order the tomahawk meal and there must be an issue with the corporate priority reservation system. I commend the Manager's patience to explain that it takes 3 hours to prepare the tomahawk and so requires the reservation. I told him that I drove 500 miles to dine there and see if he can help find a solution. He was patient but can't offer any solutions. Sigh... He did ask if there is anything he can do to make my stay more pleasant, please let him know. Hmmm... although sincere, but no real solution and no hard offers. Hey, a $5 discount coupon or some concession of something can ease my displeasure of the establishment (whether it is corporate or the operator that made the mistake for my predicament of not getting the meal I intended to have). Another solution is to start cooking another tomahawk at 6:30pm for the 9:30 client and provide the spare for me.
They close at midnight. Hey, I'm not manager to offer solutions. I felt he could have done better.
Decor (decoration) is nice but the environment feels like a flea market... as an upscale restaurant with $100-$250 meal tickets, something can be done to make it more comfy.
More comments if inquired.

Feedback at Discord: zero stars
I thought that I would provide this feedback internally to the company via their chat community. "Aiyu Jelly" handle name which is a trusted friend of the company responded by implying that i didn't read the menu. The fine print is embedded in the menu of 8x11 with a small print. Check it out. I'll bet you can't find it.
Then, some of my comments similar to this here are censored (deleted) in the feedback section! I don't know if the same person or other company person did the censoring. Why ask for feedback when censoring? And I'm locked out for 24 hours in commenting. So, here I am.
As for the server Nate, excellent 5+ stars service. Patient in hearing my orders; gives great recommendations and offers different ways to enjoy my meal. Michelin Star service.
The company should give him bonuses!
Food & drinks: 3 stars summary
Since I didn't get my intended meal of sit down served meal of tomahawk plus seafood & appetizers. -2 stars

Fruity cocktail was offered & accepted. Excellent tastes with the lychee infused alcoholic drink.
(3.0 stars.)
Meat & seafood (3 stars)
A5 steaks... filet, rib eye, ny steak all excellent quality ... 4 stars rounded down to 3 stars. And I have to cook it myself on the grill. Grill fire is quite high and not adjustable, so it's hard to cook it correctly (-1 star). Nate (server) suggested that I let the kitchen cook it. It's better but still not the best. For the buffet review: the cooked seafood quality was 3 stars ... limited in variety and bland. Lobster tail was cold & I had to put in the grill to heat it up (2 stars). Perhaps some sauce can be provided besides hot butter? The sashimi of tuna, hamachi & salmon are pretty good. (3.5 stars).
Side dishes & appetizers & dessert & coffee shishito peppers very good with right sauce
4 stars
Seabass lettuce wrap... yummy but not can be tastier or wrapped better 3.5 stars
Oxtail pot stickers... meat inside is too dry.
Sauce was nice . 1 star
Matcha cheesecake 1 star the other "x" cheesecake 3 stars
Espresso $8 is too acidic... 1 star
Wagyu taco is tasty 3 stars
Shrimp uni taco 3 stars

This was not the Premium Option, but we were sat late at 10 pm and we were told the chef‚Äôs order  from the kitchen would be closed in 15 minutes (90 minutes before closing time); therefore that destroyed the whole dinner.

Wow what a SHAM! In all the YouTube videos reviewing Niku x show giant king crab legs as long as your forearm,  but in reality they averaged 7 to 8 in. Moreover the circumference was maybe 3 in. The spiny points made it almost impossible to extract the meat! Scissors were so big and dull you couldn't cut them! With a 2 hr limit you can't ingest enough flesh too feel satisfied; punctured my fingers and lips! All you can eat lobster is now by ordering one to two at a time; time consuming. Couldn't get meat out of shell; it broke apart in fibers! They advertised oysters and scallops; ok right!
They've been removed from menu!
Crustaceans were salty and king crab dry.
$5 for 4 or 5 oz bottle of diet coke omg.
Server was nice ambiance nice; but dropped
$295 w/ parking and tip;  only thing good was beef; sea bass under cooked no smoky flavor. Bet you they'll never get me again shame on you niku x sham!

Meat quality was decent, the chinese male server talked down to our whole table, asking us how we wanted steaks cooked, when we said medium hes railroading us to get medium rare, later he talks down to me about shabu shabu as if I wouldnt know what that is when I order it. "I want this" "are you sure?" "You know what it is right?" Its like.. okay? Another member of my party was told "you know this barley tea has caffeine right", while hes drinking it, Then when we refused to pay 18-20% on a over 600$ bill, the waiter seemed to almost demand an explanation, and kept arguing with me. I understand he means well, but this environment of pretentiousness, talking down to customers, all while having barely maintained toilets, it all screams a very duck taped concept restaurant. The food quality was nowhere near the 160$ price tag. The poke at the buffet is actually the best part of the place. This restaurant was a major disappointment. I cannot believe that my parents and I spent $500 only to receive such poor service. On multiple occasions, I had to get up from the table because our server was nowhere to be found. We repeatedly asked for the table to be cleared, yet it remained cluttered throughout the meal. To make matters worse, the desserts were brought out while the table was still in the same state, as shown in the attached photo‚Äîfurther reflecting the lack of attention to service.

I chose the highest-tier buffet option, which is advertised as including premium Japanese beef cuts. However, the seafood selection was extremely underwhelming. The so-called King Crab was completely tasteless and appeared to have been frozen for a long time. As shown in the photos, the crab legs were unusually thin and lacked any substantial meat, making it clear that they had been stored frozen for an extended period. The same applies to the entire seafood bar.

Regarding the Japanese beef cuts, I have been to Japan over ten times and dined at no fewer than six reputable steak houses. Based on my experience, the beef served here was clearly frozen, and its quality was mediocre at best. While the restaurant claims to offer A5-grade meat, I find that highly unlikely. I have had A5 beef on numerous occasions, and while these cuts may indeed be Japanese, they do not meet the standards of true A5 quality.

The service was equally disappointing. Beyond the lack of attentiveness, the dessert‚Äîa simple H√§agen-Dazs ice cream‚Äîwas served in its original packaging with plastic spoons, showing a complete disregard for presentation. This level of service and quality might be acceptable at a $30-per-person establishment, but certainly not at a restaurant charging over $150 per person.

I hope this review helps others make an informed decision and avoid an experience that falls far short of expectations. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

This restaurant was a major disappointment. I cannot believe that my parents and I spent $500 only to receive such poor service. On multiple occasions, I had to get up from the table because our server was nowhere to be found. We repeatedly asked for the table to be cleared, yet it remained cluttered throughout the meal. To make matters worse, the desserts were brought out while the table was still in the same state, as shown in the attached photo‚Äîfurther reflecting the lack of attention to service.

I chose the highest-tier buffet option, which is advertised as including premium Japanese beef cuts. However, the seafood selection was extremely underwhelming. The so-called King Crab was completely tasteless and appeared to have been frozen for a long time. As shown in the photos, the crab legs were unusually thin and lacked any substantial meat, making it clear that they had been stored frozen for an extended period. The same applies to the entire seafood bar.

Regarding the Japanese beef cuts, I have been to Japan over ten times and dined at no fewer than six reputable steak houses. Based on my experience, the beef served here was clearly frozen, and its quality was mediocre at best. While the restaurant claims to offer A5-grade meat, I find that highly unlikely. I have had A5 beef on numerous occasions, and while these cuts may indeed be Japanese, they do not meet the standards of true A5 quality.

The service was equally disappointing. Beyond the lack of attentiveness, the dessert‚Äîa simple H√§agen-Dazs ice cream‚Äîwas served in its original packaging with plastic spoons, showing a complete disregard for presentation. This level of service and quality might be acceptable at a $30-per-person establishment, but certainly not at a restaurant charging over $150 per person.

I hope this review helps others make an informed decision and avoid an experience that falls far short of expectations. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

And the lobsters weren't that good, either.  I could have bought them from the market and cooked better tasting lobsters at home. I don't understand the high reviews.  I'm literally at the restaurant writing this review.  This place sucks.  Also, we had a reservation but still waited about 30 minutes. The sushi and fish did not taste fresh.  The buffet sashimi was warm.  You have to hunt down a cup for soy sauce.  I used the huge foil cup for sauce, that meant to used for hot butter for the crab legs.

We paid for the $139 experience.  We asked for sodas and they only offered sprite and Diet Coke bc they were out of other sodas.  You think for $100 a person there will be soda.  Btw the soda is in a glass bottle at almost $9.00 a bottle.

The seabass came out cold.  The sushi was warm.  The taste was off.   Most of the buffet was not tasty.  The crab legs and shrimp was the only good seafood at the buffet.

We've gone to multiple Chubby Cattles.  Rowland Heights and Little Tokyo Chubby Cattle are in a different league compared to this place.  The sushi is so much better and the sides are better at the other Chubby Cattle restaurants.

We spoke to the manager and he only discounted our Sprites!!!!!

Go to other Chubby Group restaurants.  I was looking forward to this place.  Save your money.  I thought NikuX would be amazing since it‚Äôs so much more expensive.

Btw Shiki Buffet in Temple City tasted better than this place and it's only $40.  I never get warm sushi from that buffet.

Also, you don't get a discount here if you have the membership from Chubby Cattle.  The manager told me at least get points after you pay.  Points are nice but rather have the $300 I spent at NikuX returned.

When I‚Äôve gone to Chubby Cattle in Rowland Heights we were sat in a corner table on a busy day.  The manager there felt so bad about us sitting at the worst table, he gave us one free membership.  And we didn‚Äôt even complain about the seating lol.  This place is like aww too bad you spent $300, hopefully we do a better job when you come back.  Why would we come back??? Feeling + sweet and salty. There is no sign at the entrance on the first floor, so you have to ask the staff. Do not take the hotel elevator. Parking is only valet, and if you get validation, it costs $16.50 for 2 hours and 30 minutes. Wagyu BBQ is better than seafood. King crab. Lobster, sashimi. $109 (Friday, Saturday, Sunday). Make a reservation 2 months in advance. If you don't want to wait, you can eat at the bar for $139. For $109, I grill the meat. For $139, the staff grills it and brings it to you. Japanese A5 top sirloin flower. chelf choice A5. It's delicious, but it's too oily to eat a lot, so it's a shame. I thought From Chef would be special, so I ordered a few, but except for the lobster tail, there's nothing that's "wow~ delicious", and I'm so full that it's hard to eat anything else, so I don't recommend it. I think it felt even more greasy because there were no vegetables or refreshing flavors to go with the grill. I saw oysters and scrubs on YouTube, but they weren't there the day I went. The lobster was hard to eat because the shell didn't separate because they cooked it somehow. The king crab wasn't high quality, but it was all small and low quality and not very edible, so it was a bit disappointing. You have to call 24 hours in advance for dry-aged meat. The atmosphere is good, but the servers are busy and they bring it a bit late when you order. It's a bit disappointing because there's nothing worth eating for the price. I don't think I'll come back again because the price is too high. Food: 3 Service: 3 Atmosphere: 5

The food was excellent. The service was just ok. Our waiter Jerry didn't like the tip amount and he confronted us about it and said now he had to take money out of his own pocket to get a 20% tip. Here's a tip Jerry:

Arrrrrrrgh
Surprise! No oysters, no scallops, no sashimi plate, NO GRILL!!!
It'd be nice to know that reservations with a higher price point actually does NOT get you a grill.

Service is slow. Took an hour to get water. Most dishes that's cooked from the kitchen were NOT good. I don't think I finished any of the dishes that made it to our table. Wygu meats were NOT cooked to the right temperature and were tasteless.. what a waste of all that wygy meat. Everything was lukewarm when it's served to our table.  Sigh...

Spent more and get less. Most disappointed experience of the year.

I want my money back üôÑ

Dined at this place, and the disappointments just keep rearing its ugly head. The reservation and the menu are misleading at best, downright scammy at worst.

Welcome to bait and switch at its finest.

First of all, nowhere in the reservation process tells you that if you reserve $139/$149, you will NOT have a grill. So that's the biggest surprise. When asked, the server was trained to ask back, "Did you reserve a grill?" Knowing in the reservation process, there was no indication of reserving a grill or table service. You would think that important detail should be indicated.
Not sure why their reservation system was set up this way, regardless if it's the poor planning and designing or if it's intentionally done, we felt tricked.

Second, the menu you see on their official website is a joke. You'd think the menu online is updated and is what you'll get and is what you used to decide if you'll dine here, Surprise! Most of the items we wanted are not on the "restaurant menu". For example, Oysters, grilled or raw, were nowhere to be found, and there were absolutely no scallops. The ultimate sashimi platter disappeared from the menu as well. And guess what, all the waygu meats that you see on the menu and it's at the buffet station that you thought was unlimited? Yeah, NOPE, you can't grab them because you ain't got a grill üòÇ. Jokes on you. You have to order them, and they take 30+ minutes to arrive at your table cold with no flavor. Just imagine undercooked fatty meat cold and bland in your mouth. ü§Æ

Finally, the food. Like I mentioned, the sliced waygu meats were gross. They were undercooked, cold, and tasteless. The Tomahawk Steak was good. It needed more black pepper and salt but was cooked perfectly. Handful selections of raw food at the buffet station were good. It's probably the only thing I enjoyed. Lobster tails were ok, but the crab legs sucked. The small dishes "from chef" sucked real bad. The dessert was disgusting.

NO, it's definitely not worth the price.

I wondered how I got this experience when I thought I did my research... so I skimmed through the reviews and realized almost all good reviews are made by accounts that have a total of 1 review ü§î. üôÑ Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 2 Atmosphere: 2

Having eaten at the Chubby Cattle BBQ, Mikiya, and Wagyu House by the X Pot, I'm a fan of the Chubby Cattle Restaurant Group so this review is tough for me to write because my expectations were high, especially given how difficult it was to secure a reservation here and the $149/person price point.

Long story short: This place is good as a one-time experience. Raw bar was only OK,--everything is salty except the sashimi and lobster, you do not get to cook your own meat (which means you will not be able to control the tempo / pace at which you eat or eat it "fresh" off the grill), A5 Wagyu ribeye, top blade, and tomahawk are OK, but nothing stands out especially given the $149 price point.  The one area I'd like to highlight is the amazing service. The whole staff is friendly, fast, helpful and warm!

The details:

The raw bar was just OK, the California King Crab (which looks like a mini version of the Alaska King crab) was very salty, the sashimi and lobster tails were solid, and the remaining items such as the fried chicken, salad, were OK but not what you're paying $149 for.  At the $149 price point, you will not get to cook your own meat which means that the food may come out lukewarm (like it did for us). The Tomahawk, A5 ribeye, A5 top blade were good but nothing that would make me want to come back again for. The A5 round top was very dry and I do not recommend ever ordering this. The small plates that are a must-try include the miso Chilean Sea Bass, oxtail potstickers, and katsu sando. Food: 2 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Food: 2
Service: 5
Atmosphere: 5

**Disappointing Experience at Niku X**

We had high hopes for our visit to Niku X, but unfortunately, the experience fell far short of expectations. As a group of eight, we booked the full-service option and arrived at 8:30 PM for our 8:45 reservation. Despite arriving early, we weren‚Äôt seated until 9 PM, which was frustrating and set the tone for the evening.

Once seated, things only got worse. The grill at our table was broken, and we were told there was no other table available to accommodate us. Since we paid for the full-service option, we weren‚Äôt even allowed to grill our own meat, which we would have preferred given the circumstances.

The service was painfully slow. It took over an hour for the first round of our limited 15 items to arrive, leaving us with little time to enjoy the meal within the 2-hour limit. The presentation of the meat was subpar‚Äîcuts were not well-prepared or what you'd expect from a high-end restaurant.

The most disappointing part was the quality of the food. The A5 wagyu beef from our second order was chewy and lacked the signature tenderness you‚Äôd expect from wagyu. It was so poor that we questioned whether it was even wagyu at all.

While some staff members were polite, the overall experience was not worth the $1,500 we paid. Waiting for food, dealing with a broken grill, and being unable to enjoy the meal as promised made for a truly disappointing evening. We won‚Äôt be returning and can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant. Niku restaurant is a bit of a letdown. The vibe is nice with modern decor, but it‚Äôs way too dim for my taste. Our server, Mike, was friendly and helpful. However, the buffet bar was way too dark, especially the sushi section. The lobster was tiny, like the ones you'd find at a Chinese buffet, and it was dry. The King crab was way too salty, had to drink water just to get it down. The made-to-order dishes were hit or miss. The meat was decent, but I‚Äôm not into wagyu. I prefer american ribeye which was good. Dessert options were limited, and honestly, the taste wasn‚Äôt great. I‚Äôd rather go to Chubby Cattle and pay half the price for a better experience. If I can rate this place as 0/5 I would. I was utterly appalled and frankly disappointed in this establishment. If you want cheaper AYCE wagyu/sushi, I think driving to one of their sister restaurants is more cost efficient (such as Yumiyaki, Mikiya, or even Chubby Cattle). Those other restaurants are cheaper and judging by how they serve sushi and Japanese Wagyu also, it's better to get those dishes there than pay a butt load for this place.

We got the upgraded option of $139, and opted out to order any large steaks that you pre- order (ex. tomahawks range from 35-40 oz, and some other options that you can select of your choosing.

Service: Extremely horrendous. I had runners/staff members not even know the simple aspect of having certain condiments at their restaurant. One runner said they didn't have tabasco, but had chili oil; only for a FOH manager to come by and say they have no tabasco and chili oil. Our server kept getting our orders wrong which caused a delay in our meat being served because we were sat at a non-grill table. Our server admitted to getting the orders wrong completely. Wait was over 15-20 minutes long in between waiting for the next round. Runners/servers also kept serving dishes on the side of the table even if there was room in the middle of the table. Dishes were not cleaned up. I had almost 4 plates stacked just from appetizers because I was starving between rounds of meat never coming essentially.

Ambiance: The restaurant is nice, but with the amount of complaining tables surrounding our area, I definitely didn't think that I was at a high end semi fancy restaurant at all. Interior is dark and nice, but the buffet line could use some work as it is a narrow walkway and some patrons decide to stand and block the way as well.

Food: Subpar at best. If I wanted to get expensive cut meat and be paying for 139 for it, I should be getting top quality. It was lukewarm at minimum every time we received the meat. It wasn't cooked to our medium rare liking, and some of the meats weren't the ones we ordered since our server got out order wrong multiple times.

Manager Education: Its pretty comical when even the managers of this establishment aren't well trained, couldn't answer simple questions of why the wait was taking so long, why the service was horrible, and why the raw seafood bar was completely barren for a great portion of the time. When we asked these questions, they completely invalidated our party and didn't try to resolve the solution or provide alternatives in any way possible. Pretty disappointing for a restaurant group that I've had pretty adequate experiences at their other sister restaurants.

Overall, I am not stepping into this establishment again. This wasn't even half of the entire experience. I saw an influencer table get up and not touch their food or pay at all, and then another couple order the tomahawk and have a few bites and left, and then the table that got seated after they left also got up and complained why the food was delayed and the service was pretty unbearable. I advise eating at their sister restaurants for much cheaper like chubby cattle, yumiyaki, or even mikiya. At least you'll pay for the service you're getting and the quality of food. One of the worst experiences ever and to top it off, I sent an email to their feedback group and they promised they would get back in 48 hours, and they never got back to me :(. Save your money, and your wrinkles on this place. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

STAY AWAY!! RUN, DON‚ÄôT WALK!!

We visited on 8/31 for the AYCE tasting menu for $99 and it was a big disappointment in all aspects.

To start off we had a reservation on OpenTable for 7:30PM and we arrived at 7:25PM only to wait an additional hour until we were sat.

The AYCE selection was mostly absent, the walk up bar for food was empty most of the night. Only American wagyu options were available in the fridge, no Japanese wagyu AT ALL. Crudo station was empty with exception of a few small dishes being set out occasionally that would go quickly. NO KING CRAB was ever available on any of our visits to the buffet line.

While eating, my wife bit into a small plastic bead pictured below which appears to be a hair bead that was somehow fallen into the food she ate. Absolutely disgusting!!!

As for the service, it was also atrocious!! Once we were sat, we ordered waters for the table and a kids cup for my son. My wife and I received our water but our son‚Äôs never came so we asked again. Wait 20min, still no water so we ask again. We wait again no one comes to the table to check on us or asks if we need anything until 20min later when a bus boy comes around and asks and we finally got the water for my son 40minutes after we got ours. After this, I walked to the host stand to speak to the manager about how we were upset about the food/water situation and was told that a manager would be sent over but guess what? No manager ever showed. We then asked for our check through the bus boy and waited roughly 15min before asking again because no one ever brought it. A manager was finally brought our check and we made him aware of the situation. Manager was very apologetic and offered to comp one of our meals.

I would never visit this establishment again nor would I ever recommend it.

STAY AWAY AND EAT ELSEWHERE!!!!! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 1

We originally had a 7:15 reservation on Friday July 12 and once we checked in, we were told that there were a few tables ahead of us and we could wait in the waiting area/lobby. We assumed it would be a 10-15 minute wait but 30 minutes had already passed before any type of update. We spoke to one of the front managers and he had apologized for the wait but did not have an estimated time for the next available table. He offered us the regular menu to order some appetizers while we were still waiting in the lobby, so we had placed an order for 2 Japanese Albacore with Crispy Onion handrolls to tide over our appetite. We were waiting roughly for 10-15 minutes for our order, but thankfully we were called for an open table.

We were finally seated at 8:15pm and immediately placed our food order for the DineLA menu. We received our first order of the crudo along with our order of the 2 albacore handrolls at 8:22pm. We quickly devoured those 2 items after waiting an hour to be seated. We were waiting on our next course but we did not receive it until 8:49pm. We received our Dashi Yukke Soup at a warm but not hot temperature and 27 minutes after our first course.

At this point, we were extremely hungry and disappointed in the level of execution and service at the restaurant. To wait nearly 30 minutes in between each course was completely absurd. If we continued with the same pace, our dinner would last 2 hours and we would end our dinner at 10pm. We spoke with the manager and he apologized for the wait and offered to ask the chef if they could expedite the rest of our menu. We then got the rest of the menu (Chimichurri Bone Marrow and A5 Wagyu Yakiniku) 10 minutes later. We also received the Fried Brussel Sprouts on the house.

To conclude dinner, they also sent over 2 desserts. We appreciated that they were able to comp the handrolls, brussel sprouts, and desserts for all the inconvenience. Once we received the check, the manager came over again to apologize for the wait and offered us a 15% service discount. We left the restaurant after paying.

I started feeling some stomach pains once we left the restaurant. I confided with my friend who I had ate with and she had also had slight stomach pains. On my drive home, I started to feel nauseous and knew it was definitely from something I had eaten. My friend later confided in me that she started feeling the same way around 4am. We felt horrible and found out that we both got food poisoning. We both concluded that it must have been something we had both eaten at the restaurant since we both had similar symptoms. We are both extremely disappointed in the whole experience given that Niku X holds such a high standard for food and experience. do you know how bad a place has to be in order for someone who has never submitted a review to feel compelled to write one up mere minutes after eating? you would think being on the michelin guide meant something. i have never felt more robbed by a restaurant.

let me try to paint a picture. we arrive for an 8PM reservation only to wait 20 minutes to be seated in a nowhere near full restaurant. i watch later parties be seated by the same staff that has walked by me multiple times. i have to ask the hostess if anyone planned to seat me, to her surprise.

at this point, you see the rolling robots that bring drinks and dishes to tables. it‚Äôs the kind of thing that feels cute in a small sushi joint, but feels tone-deaf in a giant upscale restaurant with tons of staff that is marketing a five-star experience.

i attempt to order sake to pair with this meal. no luck. this alleged high-end japanese wagyu joint is somehow out of nearly every sake on the list. the beverage director has to come to our table to recommend a bottle - as if they or i had a choice.

we came for the a la carte menu but decided to try the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù tasting menu thinking it‚Äôd be worth the price. we couldn‚Äôt have been more wrong.

for starters, why am i able to smell the bluefish tuna ‚Äúcrudu‚Äù (server‚Äôs words, not mine) and why does it taste fishy? the scallop was somehow cooked enough to develop a inedible outside layer. the caviar and potage are good but that in and of itself is very hard to mess up. there is no brine to the caviar and the popcorn added to the potage is gimmicky. amateur hour at a restaurant of this purported level.

you‚Äôll learn that the staff is instructed to tell you where everything is from - australian this, african that. so much so that the kimchi persian cucumber is somehow from japan. you think you came to experience japanese barbecue only to be served banchan and pregrilled vegetables slathered in sauce.

we go through 3 rounds of grilled meat and every single one of them is tough, chewy, and flavorless. it is the last 3 meats they serve where you think ‚Äúfinally‚Äù‚Ä¶ this is what you came for. the server will tell you to pick from your choice of ribeye, striploin, or kobe as your final course. he‚Äôll fail to mention that the kobe is an extra charge added to your already extremely overpriced meal.

we asked for chocolate cake and cheesecake for the dessert, but instead we got lavender cake. in our server‚Äôs words ‚Äúthis is on us.‚Äù what generosity! can someone explain how that is possible on a pre fixe meal?

i have to laugh at this entire experience to keep from feeling completely taken for a fool. absolutely nothing about this place is premium. save yourself the time and money by dining elsewhere. anywhere in sawtelle or koreatown runs laps around this overhyped and overpriced restaurant. when multiple servers pronounce wagyu as ‚Äúwa-goo‚Äù, run. I made a reservation for 5 people, got to the restaurant and we ordered some appetizers and drinks. They were out of a brand of whiskey and vodka they had on their menu which was disappointing. . When it came down to ordering food, whatever we wanted to order from the steak menu was not available since we had to order that in advance. We were unaware of this. I didn‚Äôt get a call from the restaurant to let me know how their menu works. We ordered tuna tartare and it was never brought to our table and we were charged twice for it somehow. Ordered another dish that the waitress didn‚Äôt bring and when we asked for it, she said I‚Äôm sorry it was my bad I‚Äôve been busy running around, she came back and said I‚Äôm sorry we don‚Äôt have that item right now. For a restaurant to call themselves 5 star it was very disappointing to experience all of this issues. I've never experienced going to a restaurant and not being able to order food off of their menu. Paid $800 for whatever we had ordered just to end up at Mastro‚Äôs which was two blocks away and you won‚Äôt leave there hungry. Sad part is that not a single member of management came to our table to even apologize or acknowledge how bad their service was

Food was absolutely killer, not knocking that. However the service was some of the worst I‚Äôve ever had for such a high end place. The sommelier was only around to open and decant our wines then never came back to visit. We had to constantly pour and refill our wines along with waters. The server was okay first then seemed to get worse and not care whatsoever. On top of all that he even tried to add additional fees to our bill for stuff we didn‚Äôt order and I had to track him down and get it properly fixed. Pretty disappointing.

Neutral.Context:
Niku x has gone through many changes over the years, some certainly positive. What would elevate them to a luxurious high-end Japanese restaurant rather a regular Japanese bbq buffet that offers wagyu would be if their meats were cut thicker, even if they were the same ounce. Small or even limited portions would be fair at such a deal, but sacrificing quality of the meats potential doesn‚Äôt feel right. The in-between awkwardly thin meats make it impossible to have a pink center. The meat will always be either over cooked or appear boiled. If ur going to have wagyu, gotta do it right!
Other than that, the service is amazing and the other bites prepared to order are amazing, especially the seabass wrap! Food: 3 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4

I recently went to NIKU X Los Angeles, which is on the 2nd floor of the Intercontinental Hotel.

The place has a beautiful ambience‚Äîclean, classy, and perfect for a nice night out.
They offer valet parking and validate for 2.5 hours, but since we had three cars, we still ended up paying almost $100 extra after the free hours. For just over an hour of staying‚Äîdining, picture-taking, and exploring the hotel‚Äîit felt a bit pricey just for parking.

When it comes to the food, they have two options: $109 per person and $149 per person.

The $109 already includes unlimited lobster, seafood, beef, sushi, sashimi, and more from the buffet.
The $149 option is marketed as the ‚Äúpremium experience,‚Äù with unlimited Japanese A5 Wagyu and a few other special dishes.

We decided to go for the $149 option for the experience.
The unlimited Wagyu sounds great, but to be honest, it was underwhelming.

For me, it felt overpriced and not really worth the hype.
Meanwhile, the ‚Äúspecial seafood‚Äù at $149‚Äîlike king crab legs, shrimp with caviar, and a few other items‚Äîare only served once, not unlimited.

The best part of the evening was actually the ambience and the service.

Overall, if you‚Äôre a seafood lover, I‚Äôd say just go with the $109 option.

The wives planned birthday dinner for a total of 3 very hungry dads.  We went with the Tomahawk menu.

A few things in random order:

1.) Location is great and so is the decor.
2.) We were seated promptly (a Thursday).  Party of 6 but they don't really have any rectangular tables so we sat in 1 square and 1 circular table so we could all fit.  That was odd and annoying.
3.)  Service is slow.   The place was not busy but the server would disappear for awhile.  I know it's a buffet but restaurants make $$ on drinks moreso than anything else.
4.) The drinks were....meh.   I was looking for a fancy old fashion or mule.  Instead the drink menu had 6 or 7 l drinks and it seemed all pre-made and some slushy style with alcohol.  (Felt cheap) Not a fancy menu at all for the top dollar being spent.  The wine was good but came in a bottle (lol)
5.) Seafood options - Lobster, Tiger/large shrimp, sushi.  These options were good - however - I would go elsewhere and eat that as a separate meal.
6.) The Tomahawk was ok.   We ordered 1 per couple.  It was too much because that should've been a separate meal as well.  Instead of eating buffet/unlimited seafood and a big tomahawk.   It would've been better to eat twice there at a more modest price.  (That was our bad)
7.) The Tomahawk "show" to wow us.  Meh... maybe because I got older and it was a repeat of a past experience.  We had 3 Tomahawks and got 1 show.   We had to share the first Tomahawk because they didn't bring us the other 2 until 30 mins later.   Again restaurant was not busy at all.
8.) The bill.  The bill came and certain items that were comped because of the birthday were not.  They were charged. Also, when they fixed it they taxed us on the FULL amount vs the subtotal.  Their excuse was that the item was "prepared" so it's still taxable.  Lastly on the bill.  The tip was automatically included on again the full amount including the items comped.   So where they comped???  It all was corrected after their frustration.  Table was full of numbers people so.....yeah.  Saved $30 per person...worth it.

Overall, the spot is nice and the food ok for the price point and experience.

Go once and say you went.

If you go don't do the Tomahawk.  Get at the A5 if you can and balance that with the seafood.

I had high expectations after reading all the great reviews, so I made a reservation in mid-October. The earliest available weekend slot for a party of four was late December, so I waited almost three months for this visit. I was really looking forward to it.

But maybe my expectations were too high. I thought we would have a table where we could grill the meat ourselves, but our seats were at the bar near the windows. The ventilation was excellent, but it caused the meat to cool down very quickly, and we ended up eating everything cold.

Another disappointing point was the lack of customization for how the meat was cooked. I prefer medium-rare, while my group prefers well-done, but I had no choice but to eat everything well-done. If we had been seated at a grilling table, I would have ordered medium-rare and cooked it to my preference.

When asked why I didn‚Äôt complain, it‚Äôs because it was my first visit, and I assumed the seating was assigned and grilling tables weren‚Äôt an option for us. However, my friends later told me that they were able to grill their meat and enjoy it warm. It was disappointing, especially after waiting three months for this experience.

We ordered the $139menu, but due to the holiday season, the price had increased by $10.

That said, the service was exceptional. The servers were attentive, offering sample dishes, small cocktails, and even soju, which made the experience fun. The bar was clean, and the sushi and crab were absolutely delicious.

In conclusion, while the meat was disappointing, the other aspects of the meal were satisfying. If you plan to visit, I recommend opting for the $99 menu instead. Things you should know:

The beef quality was good, but largely raw and the only seasonings available to you are pepper and salts.

The lobster tails were tiny (not much larger than some large prawns) but that's okay because it's all you can eat. The king crab was smaller than average but again, okay because all you can eat.

Aside from the wagyu, lobster, and crab, there actually isn't much else to enjoy so come here with that in mind.

Lobster, king crab and large head prawns are only served cold.

Not all tables get to grill food on their own. Sometimes you can get seated at a table where everything must be cooked for you by a kitchen.

Some items are one order per person, including their most premium dishes like the ones that have uni or caviar, which is presumably some of their most expensive items.

They no longer have the bone marrow.

Despite making reservations weeks in advance and informing them of a birthday, they ran out of their caviar/uni/sashimi dish which is limited per guest.

You can order grilled king crab but it's one per person (weird, just grill it yourself at your table, if you've got a table with a grill).

Drinks are not ayce including soft drinks.

Our server was great though. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 3 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5

Had an incredible time at Niku X! The food and atmosphere were amazing, but what really made the experience special were Darren and Byron. They were so friendly, attentive, and genuinely went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Their service made the whole night unforgettable ‚Äî thank you both! Highly recommend NikuX, especially if you‚Äôre lucky enough to have Darren and Byron taking care of you!

Hubster and I visited for our 27th wedding anniversary and we were BLOWN AWAY!  Perfect service (they actually carried in a bench seat for us because the chairs were too narrow) all the food was amazing! But I highly suggest the Chilean Sea Bass wraps! Life changing!!! The sashimi was THE best I've had in SoCal.  We loved that they had warm butter on tap (I would have preferred it to not be garlic butter) The steaks absolutely ruined me for all future steaks! Melt in your mouth doesn't do it justice.  I expected to focus on the lobster tail but to be honest, I was a little disappointed in them. I tried 3 different tails and none of them were easy to remove from the shell even though they were all cut down the back. The flavor was good however and they were nice sized. The star of the night was by far the Chilean Sea Bass!!! Do not skip it! We paid $119 each plus $16 for valet parking (loved that option) and we considered it completely worth every penny. Even if its only a once in a lifetime visit, you should definitely go! It seems like cubby cattle collaborates with Niku to tap into high end dinning but haven't figured out the branding and execution of a high end Ayce experience.

Beef quality is premium. Crabs and lobsters are overcooked like you won't believe. Literally felt like biting my own finger when biting on the big head shrimp. However they don't gate keep their good stuff. All the seafood and waygu are at the buffet station. Love the no fuss buffet.

Buffet station is small and make-shift from a bar/hallway. some of the beef and most of the "filler" type side dishes has to be ordered from the servers. It is confusing what needs to be ordered what's not, so we ended up didn't order much but just focused on the seafood and waygu at the buffet, which is good for us bad for their business lol. Types of sushi selection comes and goes at the buffet which is odd.

Guest has no dress code. We dressed up but saw flipflops lol. Overall it feels more like a chubby cattle resturant than Niku.

Niku X definitely lived up to the hype. Jerry was our server and he was amazing through our whole experience, start to finish. Very knowledgeable about the menu, both food and drinks and continued to help us pick great options. Daniel (I believe Im remembering his name right) at the host stand was also really nice and very accommodating when our table was taking longer to be ready than our reservation time.

We got the premium menu (priced at $159 pp; recently increased and not properly reflected on their whole website and certain physical menus) which included the seafood buffet and all of the steak cuts.  The steaks were all delicious, from the domestic Wagyu to the delicious JP A5, and the self serve seafood buffet was full enough that everyone could find something to enjoy. They also had restock times for some of the more popular items as well as utensils like seafood scissors and crab crackers which were necessities.

I‚Äôd definitely take some time to consider what you‚Äôre going to want to get and when‚Äîlike getting a buffet plate and enjoying what you got first before ordering some steak‚Äîso you don‚Äôt let certain foods get cold or cross flavors you may not have intended to, which was a slight issue I had figured may (and did) happen, but that didn‚Äôt take away from the food quality.

Great overall experience from the whole staff. I‚Äôd go again simply to enjoy the experience differently, maybe at one of the KBBQ style table grills or just ordering my dinner differently, but if you‚Äôre thinking about giving it a go and/or concerned about the price point, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs worth your while at least once to see and judge for yourself ! We booked a couple of weeks in advance for a party on Saturday for three adults.  We selected the non BBQ. There were several options for an All You Can Drink to go along with your meal which includes soft  drinks, beers and soju for $20. But honestly how much can you drink with the great selection of options to eat.  All of the meats were good. They came in 5oz and 3oz portions.  Cooked to order.    But you would expect so for $150 per head.  The side options were good.  The seafood was a great accompaniment and for some reason the chilled fruits helped contrast the fatty meats between bites.  The only think I would change if we went next time would be to select the self bbq option.  It was an issue that the smaller meat portions  cooked to order were served on large cold plates.  So when they get to you the wagyu is already on the cold side.  They should have preheated the plates or served on something that was less heat conducting.  Still a good evening but expensive! Especially with the parking on top. Price per person $100+ Food: 4 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 5 Reservation Not sure Noise level Moderate noise Wait time No wait

My boyfriend and I came here twice in a week! First time was to celebrate his birthday and second time we brought his parents . The service was excellent both times, we didn‚Äôt catch our servers name the first time, but today it was Nessie. Absolutely love the food, the atmosphere, and the service. Another success from the chubby group :) . I‚Äôm obsessed!!! We made reservations both times , not sure how walk ins are like but I still highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time it does seem to get pretty busy. For the parking garage, I think you can self park sometimes but we valet both times. First time parking was full and they said valet only, second time, we just went straight to valet and the staff did mention it was also valet only . You get a 2 hour validation from the restaurant so parking will be $16.50 :) . Even the parking staff were immaculate. My boyfriend and I both had bad experiences with valet but service here in this building is superb :) . 10/10 experience all around ! For a whole restaurant chain known to focus on Japanese Waygu, Niku X is supposed to be one of their flagships. To that end they deliver on the vibe and experience, but the food is rougher.

Overall the buffet is high quality, but the Waygu options, at least on the regular buffet menu, are decidedly meh - they have other Chubby Group restaurant brands that do a better job for the money. If you go for the higher end menu the experience is likely better but then you‚Äôre even more of a premium. Combined with the fact that reservations are so hard to get and I am decidedly meh.

Final note, service is indeed excellent, and Joe, our server, was terrific. **BEWARE**
If you're going for the buffet, make sure you make a reservation if possible! Otherwise, you'll end up sitting at the bar and obligated to take the $139 option (that's what happened to my group of 4), And me being someone who doesn't love seafood, the $139 option is overpriced for me. But honestly, I think it was the better experience, even though it was our first time there and we missed out on being able to cook our own food. The bartenders Joseph (and I forgot the other guys name... sorry üò¨) were awesome! They were so attentive and helpful in the food selection process. On top of that, they were great conversationalists and artists of concoctions. Even the other staff members that crossed our path were really cool. It was like we sat in the VIP area and were the only ones there! üòÇ All the food was delicious and there were many top notch meat selections. The sea bass is a MUST try! üíãüëåüèº The vibe is casual but classy. (Heads up, though, they only play K-Pop so if you go I hope you're either a fan or don't mind.) It was an experience and I would definitely go back! I went to Niku X for the second time last night. I requested Wilson L. for my server because he gave us top-notch service the 1st time we ever visited. I brought back my family and it was a fantastic night. I read and saw some recent reviews on both IG and YT complaining that they were left hungry and servers deliberately withheld food for long periods of time or wouldn't refill the buffet. I absolutely did not see any of that the entire two hours I ate there.

Our server Wilson always made sure to check on us frequently and make sure our orders came out in a timely manner. If there was a little wait on any item, he always came to let us know immediately and asked if we wanted anything else. However we never waited too long for anything and we had a delicious and fantastic meal. Also I never saw the buffet empty like some reviewers said. There always was a refill on food and honestly it was worth every penny to dine here.

There are so many things available in our $139 buffet that honestly 1 trip and even 2 trips is not enough to try out the entire menu. There are still menu items we have not tried because we got full early on. I don't understand why one YouTuber complained that he spent $140 for buffet but was still hungry afterwards because they didn't refill his food or fulfill most of his orders on time. We never experienced any of that both times we dined. And we felt the food was fantastic. But you have to try to see what you like. I didn't really like the sushi and sashimi platter from the $140 buffet menubut I enjoyed the sashimi that was in the buffet line instead. I thought the oxtail potstickers were average but all of their Wagyu Beef absolutely delicious and amazing. I could go on and on but you really need to try and what find what you like. Most of what is offered is absolutely delicious.
I plan on coming back to celebrate more special occasions here. Thank you Niku X and to our server Wilson for making our night at Niku X a fantastic and relaxing experience with lots of delicious food memories! A must try experience - great quality meat and seafood!

Booked full service for 2 ($139pp) on a Thursday night. Arrived a few minutes late due to LA traffic - NikuX is located in the same building as the Intercontinental hotel in DTLA, on the second floor. Seated within 5 minutes in a nice window seat.

With the full-service menu, you get to order unlimited amounts of everything on the menu and some special items once.

Unlimited items: some items require preparation and you need to order the day before your reservation, such as the 45-day aged tomahawk - which we ordered. When we sat down, we immediately ordered Japanese A5 ribeye and tenderloin.

What we liked:
- Japanese A5 steaks - sliced thin, good quality, not a lot in each serving but because of the heavy fat content it fills you up quickly!
- Wagyu fried rice - whoever is working the wok on the rice is doing a great job!
- Unlimited lobster tails and king crab legs at the buffet - served chilled on ice, but supplied with lemons and butter and very fresh. And they‚Äôve cut the lobster tails in half to make it even easier to eat.
- Miso Sea bass - served in ‚Äúcubes‚Äù that were pan fried and served on a skewer. Very tasty

Not fans of:
- Shishito pepper

The special items (limited to one per person)
- Sashimi special - uni, toro, salmon, caviar - what‚Äôs not to like? Very tasty. Small portion but it was very good. I had both portions for the two of us that went‚Ä¶yum!
- King crab stuffed - served hot - very good
- Big head shrimp - served hot - also very good

Buffet - shrimp, other wagyu food options, like curry, fresh salad, vegetables, tempura - all unlimited and self-serve. Good selection.

Cocktails / wine - expansive menu - prices are about what you would expect for LA prices.

Service - Wissal was our server - very friendly - informative and professional. Thanks for a great time! In terms of the food service, honestly it was a bit slow. I know you get 2 hours to eat but we often sat 15-20 minutes with no steak despite ordering. That would probably be my only point of negative feedback. Quality was great. We left super full - but the long lag times to get cooked steak out on the full-service option was a bit disappointing. Next time, I might skip the full service and just get the self-service and cook my own meat over a Korean BBQ and take the wagyu they had at the buffet.

Now - if you make it to the end and you still have room for dessert - you can try it. Their tiny dessert station didn‚Äôt have anything great in my opinion. We tried a few things and were underwhelmed. But hey - we were already bursting at the seams from all the Wagyu :)

A must try! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 5 Recommended dishes Wagyu Fried Rice, King Crab and Snow Crab Legs, Premium Seafood, Tomahawk Wagyu

Had a reservation for 2 for Niku X on Friday night at 9:30 PM. Niku X is located in the Wilshire-Grand Building on the 2nd floor on the opposite side of the Intercontinenal Hotel. Found street parking on Figueroa & 6th. We took the escalators up and were about 20 minutes early, we were greeted by the hostess and led to the waiting area and given a drinks menu. Originally our reservation was for the $99 option but we decided to do the $139 instead (unfortunately we did not get to do the tomahawk that is part of the $139 option as we needed to preorder by 1:30 PM). We waited about 5 minutes and were led to our giant table with a grill in the center. Mikey introduced himself to us as our server and he was cool, friendly and very attentive along with the other staff.

To start off there is the self-serve buffet style salad bar (NIKU salad, mushrooms & zucchini for grilling, seafood salad, kimchi, fruit), then the crudo bar (wagyu tartare, bluefin tuna toro w/ scallion, salmon, A5 wagyu tartare, amberjack, halibut, scallop, ceviche), then the hot foods (white rice topped with furikake, wagyu curry, wagyu mapo tofu, fried veggies, shrimp tempura and then the meat locker (Japanese A5 chef's choice steak, Japanese A5 top sirloin, American Wagyu Ribeye, American Wagyu Striploin, American Wagyu Tenderloin) and then the chilled seafood (oysters, scallops, lobster tail, snow crab legs & king crab legs) and the condiments (lemon, cajun butter, pink peppercorn mignonette & yuzu cocktail sauce) and lastly a small dessert section.

There were items on the menu that you had to order through your server. We tried the potato pave, oxtail potstickers, A5 wagyu sando, miso Chilean sea bass, wagyu tallow shishito peppers, wagyu sukiyaki, and lamb lollipop. Because of the $139 option we were each allowed to order 1 item from the Chef's Special Seafood so we chose the ultimate sashimi platter (assorted sashimi, uni, foie gras, caviar) and sushi platter which was incredible. The quality of fish was very fresh, each piece of sushi was dabbed with a little sauce/tare and the slightly acidic vinegar rice was perfect and really opened up the appetite.

The meat what can I say? Every single piece melted in the mouth, after a slight sear on both sides of the beef and got great maillard reaction. You can season your meat with the condiments at the table  (salt, pepper, chili powder, wasabi salt, house blend, truffle salt). Our favorites were definitely the Japanese cuts, they were VERY rich and a little goes a long way but it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience throughout being able to enjoy small dishes of quality seafood from the crudo bar or some salad  in between the rich meat and most definitely the seafood... not many places offer king crab legs so this is legit, crab crackers and crab shears provided as well, the crab meat were both so naturally sweet with a bit of brininess from the salt water, id say the crab legs alone make it worth it, just go to Costco and take a look at the cooked red king crab legs. I didn't try any of the desserts or hot food items except for the wagyu fried rice and shrimp tempura but I'll definitely be back to enjoy the full experience, hopefully with an earlier reservation time.

Also, this is a restaurant part of the Chubby Group (Chubby Cattle, Chubby Curry, Wagyu House, Yumiyaki, Mikiya, Chubby Skewers) so make sure you get the app and points! Unless you‚Äôre vegetarian, you will love your experience at Niku X. They have beautiful aesthetics and a high attention to detail. The interior architecture is modern and elegant, while the decorations and food presentation compliment these themes. The staff are very kind, though one of them acted a bit informal. Our server was very friendly, which I love in a course meal, being able to chat with them during the experience. The only downside of the space is that the restaurant was playing upbeat music which was loud. It was a bit bothersome and was hard to hear the servers explaining each course.
Onto the food, I highly recommend the course meals because these are experiences designed from beginning to last and they give you a full experience. I chose the lower priced menu because the starters felt more appealing, and they definitely hit the spot. All the dishes throughout the night are very rich, overflowing with umami flavors from ingredients like truffle, Wagyu, and egg yolk. At the same time, the chefs at Niku X know to pair these fatty beef cuts with acidic garnishes like lemon and ume, which helps balance out the intensity. I can nitpick a few things, but that is after understanding that the whole meal was amazing. With the tenderloin, they present it on a small, soft slice of bread and this portion was hard to eat without it all falling apart. The sukiyaki had a whole shiso leaf with it to eat, and that was overbearing over the rest of the ingredients.
If you are looking for a premium dinner experience, definitely look to Niku X to be pampered with an incredibly enjoyable night. Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+ Food: 5 Service: 5 Atmosphere: 4 Recommended dishes

This was my first time ever eating at a Michelin-rated restaurant! My boyfriend and I had an amazing experience! We made a reservation a week in advance and were seated promptly by the window with a great view.

We ordered only from the A La Carte menu because we wanted to have more control over our dining experience.

Started off with the Oxtail & Wagyu Potstickers and the Wagyu Tartare. The potstickers were tasty and had a lot of savory/umami/citrus notes. The tartare was a completely new experience for both of us as we'd never eaten raw beef before. It was seasoned really well and the texture wasn't off putting. Quail egg was a great touch.

Next we were served our choices of meat: Masami Outside Skirt Wagyu, Miyazaki Tri Tip, and Stone Axe Short Rib. The wagyu was melt-in-your-mouth delicious and a favorite for both of us. The other two cuts were slightly more tough to chew, but sooo flavorful and buttery. The server gave us pairing recommendations for the condiments & meat.

The star of the show was truly the Dry Aged Masami Strip Loin. We got an 8 oz. portion instead of 6 oz. due to our order being put in incorrectly. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare!

Finally ended our dinner with the Wagyu Fried Rice. This was tasty and had flavor components that a traditional fried rice wouldn't have. Lots of citrus notes and the egg presentation was beautiful. The wagyu bits were cut up so tiny though, it made me forget there was wagyu in the dish at all.

Lastly, they treated us to two complimentary desserts! We got the matcha pillow and the cr√®me br√ªl√©e. The matcha pillow is just matcha ice cream, but I could tell the matcha quality was very good. The cr√®me br√ªl√©e wasn't anything special but it was good!

I'm subtracting 1-star because I do think they're still getting into the swing of things, as they haven't officially had a grand opening yet. For first timers, I think there could have been a bit more assistance with explaining the menu beforehand - we had to ask the waiter for recommendations! The format of the meat grilling felt a little awkward at times because the server was just standing there watching us eat. And as I mentioned earlier, there was a misunderstanding with the order, so the strip loin and fried rice weren't put in until we asked about it later. We fortunately didn't have to pay for parking because we didn't drive, but I do think the $16.50 fee for parking valet is a bit ridiculous for how much you're paying to eat. Overall though this made for a perfect date night and our waiter Meng was fantastic! I really appreciated when he brought out the strip loin and he told us to start video recording because the steak reveal was so grand! Service Dine in Meal type Dinner Price per person $100+

What an experience!!! Had the pleasure of enjoying the tasting menu at Niku X. The menu items were curated nicely. We were greeted with welcoming smiles and seated promptly even thought we arrived a little early for our reservation. The staff was very accommodating and informative of the experience, menu items and aging process of the meat. The way the staff moved around and made things happen felt so "top secret" and movie-like.. I absolutely loved the vibe.
The food was literally works of art presented on platters. Just picture perfect and indulgent at the same time. The food was wonderful, rich and again a well planned adventure. I LOVE that some of our humongous (and delicious) steak was used to prepare our fried rice later in the meal. Some of my favorite dishes were the salad, oxtail wontons, 16 layer potato stack and the Bone marrow. (That's like everything lol)
Oh and PLEASE slather your steak in the egg sauce ... AH-mazing!! (I poured a bit over my fried rice too)
If you are up for a foodie adventure, definitely visit Niku X.  Perfect for a special occasion as well!
There were other items I wanted to try on the menu but the portions on the tasting menu were perfectly filling.
I Will definitely return sooner than later cause I had my eye on the Uni caviar dish!

Negative.Context:
Over rated, over priced, and such a huge disappointing. This was supposed to be the highlight of our trip to LA. Instead it became the worst part of it.
We sat at a table without a grill - meaning our food was to be prepped by a chef and delivered to us instead of us cooking it ourselves (Korean bbq style). What I thought this meant was the food would be prepped to perfection and our service would be a lot better since the price difference was $50 per person. Instead we got cooked meat delivered to us cold, the slowest service I have ever seen at any restaurant, and pretty much the worst experience I have had in a very very long time. Every single time we ordered meat it came to our table cold. But because wagyu is so high in fat, the fat didn‚Äôt ‚Äúmelt in our mouth‚Äù it felt like we were chewing sticks of butter/lard. Dish after dish came this way. I was nearly about to lose my mind until we finally decided that we were both just done and ready to leave. That made me feel a lot better to just give up on the experience and decide to escape the place entirely.  The manager came by and asked if we were doing ok but it was only by the time we were about to ask for our check after the entire horrendous experience and leave. So he was too late. Nothing really happened after he heard about our experience. He said sorry and that he hoped he could make it right but we only had one more serving of meat left from our earlier order so there was really nothing he could have done except maybe make sure the last two tiny portions of meat don‚Äôt come out stone cold.
Their buffet food was very low quality, the service was super slow, and the price was really too high for what you get.
Anyways, I highly recommend skipping this place and I‚Äôm really not sure how they have such high ratings. They do seem to have a strong social media presence. Maybe that has something to do with it. Please just beware and don‚Äôt get disappointed like we did! Food: 1 Service: 1 Atmosphere: 4
